original: Aññapaccayepi chidassa “cchaṅa” iti yogavibhāgā cchaṅa, bhūte ūṃ paccaye acchecchuṃ🔽acchindiṃsu. Vuttato aññadhātūnañca, gama=gamane, gacchaṃ gacchissaṃ. Aññapaccayepi
analyzed: añña paccaye pi chidassa cchaṅaḥ iti yogavibhāgā cchaṅa bhūte ūm paccaye acchecchuṃ  a chindiṃsu vuttataḥ añña dhātūnam ca gama gamane gaccham gacchissam añña paccaye pi
translated: In the other verbs, too, the form is “cchaṅa” by the rule of the Yogavibhāga. In the case of the nouns bhūta, ūṃ, paccaya, acchaṃ, acchecchuṃ, accindiṃsu.

original: vaca=byattavacane iccādi, kamme-bahulādhikārā tyādīsu parabhūtesupi yathāgamaṃ vacādīnañcassa🔽“vacādīnaṃ vassuṭa vā”ti kamme uṭa ca “assū”ti assa u ca, tena dhammo uccati vuccati,
analyzed: vaca byatta vacane i c ādi kamme bahula adhikārā tya ādīsu para bhūte supi yathāgamam  vaca ādīnam vassuṭa vāti kamme uṭa ca assu ati assaḥ u ca tena dhammaḥ uccati vuccati
translated: In the case of other verbs, too, the form is “gacchaṃ, gacchissaṃ” by the rule of the Yogavibhāga. In the case of the verbs vac = “is to be spoken,” etc., in the kamme-bahulādhikārā tyādīsu, the forms are “vacā, vacissā” in the case of the other verbs, too, by the rule of the Yogavibhāga.

original: vuccanti iccādi, yassa ca pubbarūpaṃ.
analyzed: vuccanti id ca ādi yassa ca pubbarūpam
translated: “Vacādīnaṃ vassuṭa vā” in the kamme, and “assū” in the case of the other verbs, too, by the rule of the Yogavibhāga. “Uccati, vuccati, vuccanti,” etc.

original: 27. Bhuja muca vaca visānaṃ kkhaṅa
analyzed: bhuja muca vaca visānam kkhaṅa
translated: . The forms of the verbs bhuja, muca, vaca, visānaṃ, kkhaṅa

original: Bhujādīnaṃ kkhaṅa hoti ssena saha. Vakkhati vacissati, vakkhanti vacissanti iccādi.🔽21. Īādo vacassoma
analyzed: bhuja ādīnam kkhaṅa hoti ssena saha vakkhati vacissati vakkhanti vacissanti iccādi  ī ā daḥ vacaḥsoma
translated: The forms of the verbs bhuja, etc., are “vakkhati, vacissati, vakkhanti, vacissanti,” etc., by the rule of the Yogavibhāga.🔽. The forms of the verb vac in the case of Īādo

original: Īādīsu vacassa oma hoti. Makārānubandhattā “mānubandho sarāna+mantā paro”ti paribhāsato
analyzed: ī ādīsu vacassa oma hoti makāra anubandha ttā ma anubandhaḥ paroti paribhāsato
translated: The forms of the verb vac are “vakkhāma, vakkhāma, vakkhāma, vakkhāma,” etc., by the rule of the Yogavibhāga.

original: sarā paro. Avoci, avocuṃ, avoco iccādi. Anajjatane-avaca avacā vacā iccādi. Kriyātipattiyaṃ-avakkhā🔽avacissā, avakkhiṃsu avacissiṃsu iccādi. Vaceyya iccādi. Kamme-vucceyya iccādi. Tathā🔽vacatu, vuccatu iccādi.🔽Bhuja=pālanajjhohāresu, “bhujā” dinā kkhavādese bhokkhati bhuñjissati.
analyzed: sarā paraḥ avoci avocum avocaḥ iccādi an ajja tane avaca avacā vacā iccādi  avacissāḥ avakkhiṃsu avacissiṃsu iccādi vaceyya iccādi kamma ivucceyya iccādi tathā  vacatu vuccatu it ca ādi  bhuja pālana jhohāresu bhujā dinā kkha va ādese bhokkhati bhuñjissati
translated: Sarā paro. Avoci, avocuṃ, avoco, etc. Anajjatane—avaca, avacā, vacā, etc. Kriyātipattiyaṃ—avakkhā, avakkhāsi, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāmi, avakkhāma, avakkhāmi, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma

original: Kusa=akkose, āpubbo, tassa rasso ca, akkosati iccādi ñeyyaṃ, lavikaraṇalopavuddhiyo.🔽34. Kusa+ruhehī+ssa chi🔽Kusā ruhā ca parassa īssa chi vā hoti. Pararūpapaṭhamakkharāni, akkocchi akkosi iccādi. Abhipubbo ruha=rohane, abhirucchi abhiruhi iccādi.🔽Vaha=pāpuṇane, vahati, vahanti. Kamme-kye “hassa vipallāso”ti vipariyāso, tena so🔽vuyhati, “assū”ti uttaṃ. Vahissati, vuyhissati. Avahi, avuyhittha, avuhi. Avahissā,
analyzed: kusa akkose ā pubbaḥ tassa rasso ca akkosati iccādi ñeyyam la vi karaṇa lopa vuddhiyaḥ 🔽kusaruhehīssa chi 🔽kusā ruhā ca parassa īssa chi vā hoti para rūpa paṭhama kkharāni akkocchi akkosi iccādi abhipubbaḥ ruha rohane abhirucchi abhiruhi iccādi 🔽vaha pāpuṇane vahati vahanti kammekye hassa vipallāso ti vipariyāso tena so 🔽vuyhati uttam vahissati vuyhissati avahi avuyhittha avuhi avahissā
translated: Sarā paro. Avoci, avocuṃ, avoco, etc. Anajjatane-avaca, avacā, vacā, etc. Kriyātipattiyaṃ-avakkhā, avakkhāsi, avakkhāma, avakkhātha, avakkhāmi, avakkhāma, avakkhī, avakkhīma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma, avakkhāma

original: vuyhīssā iccādi. Vaheyya, vuyheyya. Vahatu, vuyhatu iccādi.
analyzed: iccādi vaheyya vuyheyya vahatu vuyhatu iccādi
translated: The forms are: vaheyya, vuyheyya, vahatu, vuyhatu, etc.

original: Jara=jīraṇe,
analyzed: jara jīraṇe
translated: Jara = to grow old,

original: 5,174. Jara marāna+mīyaṅa🔽Jara marānaṃ īyaṅa vā hoti māna+nta+tyādīsu. Jīyati. “Jara sadāna+mīma”ti īmaāgamo
analyzed: jara mara anamīyaṅa  vā hoti vā
translated: Jara and marana have the syllable īyaṅa,🔽Jīyati. “Jara sadānaṃ īma” (Pā. 1. 1. 10) has the addition of īma.

original: lo ca, jīrati. Kamme-jīrīyati jīyīyati. Evaṃ jīyissati jīrissati, jīyīyissati jīrīyissati.
analyzed: ca jīrati evam jīyissati jīrissati jīyīyissati
translated: Lo has the form jīrati. In the passive voice: jīrīyati, jīyīyati. The forms are: jīyissati, jīrissati, jīyīyissati, jīrīyissati, etc.

original: Ajīyi ajīri, ajīyīyi ajīrīyi. Ajīyissā ajīrissā, ajīyīyissā ajīrīyissā ajīyissā ajīrīyissā
analyzed: ajīyi ajīri ajīyīyi ajīrīyi ajīyissā ajīrissā ajīyīyissā ajīyissā ajīyissā
translated: Ajīyi, ajīri, ajīyīyi, ajīrīyi, ajīyissā, ajīrissā, ajīyīyissā, ajīrīyissā, ajīyissā, ajīrīyissā, etc.

original: iccādi. Mara=pāṇacāge, īyaṅa, mīyati marati, mīyanti maranti iccādi.
analyzed: i t ca ādi mara pāṇa ca āge īyaṅa mīyati marati mīyanti maranti it ca ādi
translated: Mara = to give up life, has the syllable īyaṅa, mīyati, marati, mīyanti, maranti, etc.

original: Disa=pekkhane,🔽5,124. Disassa passa dassa dasa da dakkhāti
analyzed: disa apekkhane  disassa passa dassa dasa da dakkhāti
translated: Disa = to look,

original: Ete ādesā disassa vā honti. Anekavaṇṇattā sabbādeso. Passati passanti, dakkhati dakkhanti. Kamme-kye pubbarūpo, dissati dissanti, vipassīyati dakkhīyati iccādi.
analyzed: ete ādesāḥ disassa vā honti aneka vaṇṇattā sabba ādesaḥ passati passanti dakkhati dakkhanti kammekye pubba rūpaḥ dissati dissanti vipassīyati dakkhīyati iccādi
translated: . Passa, dassa, dasa, da, dakkha are the prefixes of disa. The forms are: passati, passanti, dakkhati, dakkhanti. In the passive voice: dissati, dissanti. Vipassīyati, dakkhīyati, etc.

original: 6,69. Dakkha+kha+heti+hohīti lopo
analyzed: dakkha kha heti ho hi iti lopaḥ
translated: . Dakkha + kha + heti + hoti is elided,🔽.

original: Dakkhādīhi ādesehi parassa ssassa lopo vā hoti. Dakkhati dakkhissati. Apassi passi,🔽apassiṃsu passiṃsu apasso passo, apassittha passittha. Apassiṃ passiṃ, apassimha🔽passimha. Tathā adassī dassī, adassiṃsu dassiṃsu iccādi. Anajjatane dasādeso, addasā
analyzed: dakkha ādīhi ādesehi parassa ssassa lopaḥ vā hoti dakkhati dakkhissati apassi passi  a passiṃsu passiṃsu a passaḥ passaḥ apassittha passittha a passim passim apassimha  tathā a dassī dassī a dassiṃsu dassiṃsu icca ādi an ajjatane dasa ādesaḥ addasā
translated: The vowel of the 1st person singular of the Perfect is elided before the endings -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -siṃsu, -si, -siṃ, -siṃsu, -siṃha, -siṃha, -

original: addasa. Addā adda iccādi. Apassissa dakkhissa iccādi. Passeyya dakkheyya, passatu dakkhatu iccādi.
analyzed: addasa addā addaḥ iccādi a passissa dakkhissa iccādi passeyya dakkheyya passatu dakkhatu iccādi
translated: In the Aorist, etc., the ss of the 3rd person plural is dropped optionally before the following particles: dakkhati, dakkhissati; apassi, passi; apassiṃsu, passiṃsu; apasso, passo; apassittha, passittha; apassiṃ, passiṃ; apassimha, passimha; tathā adassī, dassī; adassiṃsu, dassiṃsu, etc. In the Imperfect, the desis is changed to das: addasā, addasa; addā, adda, etc. In the Conditional, the desis is changed to dakkhis: apassissa, dakkhisso, etc. In the Optative, the desis is changed to passeyya, dakkheyya: passeyya, dakkheyya; passatu, dakkhatu, etc.

original: Sada=visaraṇagatyāvasādanādānesu, nipubbo, “jarasadāna+mīma vā”ti īmaāgamo. Nisīdati, nisīdanti iccādi. Bhāve-nisajjati, nisajjate.
analyzed: sada visaraṇa gati avasādana ādānesu nipubbaḥ vāti īma āgamaḥ nisīdati nisīdanti iccādi bhāvenisajjati nisajjate
translated: Sada=sitting down, sitting, sitting on, sitting in, sitting by, sitting at, sitting upon, sitting in the attitude of meditation, sitting in the posture of meditation. The reduplicate form is nisīdati, nisīdanti, etc. In the passive voice, the reduplicate form is nisajjati, nisajjate, etc.

original: Yaja=devapūjāsaṃgatikaraṇadānesu, yajati, yajanti iccādi. Kamme –
analyzed: yaja deva pūjā saṃgati karaṇa dānesu yajati yajanti iccādi kamme
translated: Yaja=worshipping the gods, associating with, doing, giving. The reduplicate form is yajati, yajanti, etc. In the passive voice, the reduplicate form is yajjīyati, yajjīyare, etc.

original: 5,113. Yajassa yassa ṭi+yīti
analyzed: yajassa yassa ṭiyi iti
translated: Yajassa yassa ṭi+yī

original: Yajassa yassa ṭi+yī honti kānubandheti bahulādhikārā tyādivisayepi kye pubbarūpe
analyzed: yajassa yassa ṭiyī honti ka anubandhā iti bahula adhikārā tya ādi visaye pi kye pubbarūpe
translated: Yajassa yassa ṭi+yī are optionally substituted for the final syllable, according to the rule “tyādivisayepi kye pubbarūpe,” “in the reduplicate forms of the passive, the final syllable is optionally changed to tyādiv

original: ca ijjati yijjati mayā buddho. So yajissati, tena ijjissate yijjissate. So yajī,
analyzed: ca ijjati yijjati mayā buddhaḥ saḥ yajissati tena ijjissate yijjissate saḥ yajī
translated: and yajati, yajjati, mayā buddho. So yajissati, tena ijjissate yijjissate. So yajī,

original: tena ijji yijji. So yajissā, tena ijjissā yijjissā. So yajeyya, tena ijjeyya yijjeyya.
analyzed: tena ijji yijji saḥ yajissā tena ijjissā yijjissā saḥ yajeyya tena ijjeyya yijjeyya
translated: tena ijji yijji. So yajissā, tena ijjissā yijjissā. So yajeyya, tena ijjeyya yijjeyya.

original: So yajatu, tena ijjatu yijjatu iccādi.
analyzed: saḥ yajatu tena ijjatu yijjatu iccādi
translated: So yajatu, tena ijjatu yijjatu, etc.

original: Vada=vacane, “gamavadā” dinā vadassa vajjādeso vā, lassa “ūlasse”ti kvaci e ca, vajjati
analyzed: vada vacane gama vadā ā dinā vadassa vajja ādesaḥ vā lassa ū lassa iti kvaci e ca vajjati
translated: Vada = to speak: “Gamavadā” (in the text) is the reduplicated form of vad, or the reduplicated form of l, as in “ūlasse” (in the text). The reduplicated form is vajjati,

original: vadeti vadati, vajjenti vadenti iccādi. Kamme – “kyassā”ti īña, vajjīyati vajjati
analyzed: vadeti vadati vajjenti vadenti iccādi kamme vajjīyati vajjati
translated: vadeti, vadati, etc. In the passive: “Kyassā” (in the text) is īña. Vajjīyati, vajjati,

original: vadīyati, vajjīyanti vajjanti vadīyanti. Vadissati, vadissanti. Avadī vadī, avadiṃsu
analyzed: vadīyati vajjīyanti vajjanti vadīyanti vadissati vadissanti avadī vadī avadiṃsu
translated: vadīyati, vajjīyanti, vajjanti, vadīyanti. Vadissati, vadissanti. Avadī, vadī, avadiṃsu,

original: vadiṃsu. Avadissa vadissa. Vajje vajjeyya vade vadeyya, vajjeyyuṃ vadeyyuṃ. Vajjetu
analyzed: vadiṃsu a vadissa vadissa vajje vajjeyya vade vadeyya vajjeyyum vadeyyum vajjetu
translated: vadiṃsu. Avadissa, vadissa. Vajje, vajjeyya, vade, vadeyya, vajjeyyuṃ, vadeyyuṃ. Vajjetu,

original: vadetu vadatu iccādi yathāgamaṃ ñeyyaṃ.
analyzed: vadetu vadatu id ca ādi yathāgamam ñeyyam
translated: vadetu, vadatu, etc. should be known according to the rules.

original: Kamu=padavikkhepe, “parokkhāyañcā”ti caggahaṇena kama kama iti dvitte anādibyañjanalope
analyzed: kamu pada vikkhepe parokkhā yat ca ati ca ggahaṇena kama kamaḥ iti an ādi byañjana lope
translated: Kamu = in the sense of scattering the feet: “Parokkhāyañcā” (in the text) is the reduplicated form of k, k, etc. In the reduplicated form, the initial consonant is elided.

original: lavikaraṇe “kavaggahā” dinā kassa ce niggahītāgame ca kate caṃkamati kamati iccādi.
analyzed: la vikaraṇe ka vaggahāḥ ādinā kassa ce niggahīta āgame ca kate caṃkamati kamati icca ādi
translated: In the causative of the root LAU, “to take,” the form is kavaggahaṃ, and in the causative of the root NI, “to bind,” the form is niggahitāgame. And in the causative of the root CAṂ, “to walk,” the form is caṃkamati.

original: Cala=kampane, caṃcalati. Jala+dala=dittiyaṃ, dvitte daddallati iccādi. (Savuddhikabhūvādinayo).🔽Hū+bhū=sattāyaṃ, tyādīsu “kattari lo”ti lo, tassa lope “yuvaṇṇāna+meo paccaye”ti okāro. So hoti, te honti. Hosi, hotha. Homi, homa iccādi. Bhāve-tena hūyati hūyate.🔽31. Hūssa he+hehi+hohi ssatyādo
analyzed: cala kampane caṃcalati jala dala dittiyam dvitte iccādi  hū bhū sattā ayam tyādīsu kattari lo ti lo tassa lope paccaya iti okāraḥ saḥ hoti te honti hosi hotha homi homaḥ iccādi bhāva etena hūyati hūyate  hūssa he he hi hohi ssatya adaḥ
translated: In the causative of the root CAL, “to tremble,” the form is caṃcalati. In the causative of the root JALA, “to see,” the form is dvitte daddallati. (The method of the verbal nouns ending in -u, etc., is finished.)🔽In the causative of the root HŪ, “to be,” the forms are hoti, honti, hosi, hotha, homi, homa, etc. In the passive, the forms are hūyati, hūyate.🔽The forms he, hehi, hohi, etc., are formed from hū by the addition of the passive endings, according to the rule: “The passive is formed by adding the passive endings to the present stem in the active voice.”

original: Hūssa heādayo honti ssaccādo. Hessati hehi ssati hohissati.🔽69. Dakkha+kha+hehi+hohīhi lopoti🔽Dakkhādīhi ādesehi parassa ssassa vā lopo hoti. Hehiti hehissati, hohiti hohissati.
analyzed: hūssa he ādayaḥ honti hessati hehi ssati hohissati  dakkha kha hehi ho hīhi lopaḥ uti  dakkha ādīhi ādesehi parassa ssassa vā lopaḥ hoti he hiti he hissati ho hiti ho hissati
translated: The forms hehiti, hehissati, hohiti, hohissati, etc., are formed by the addition of the passive endings to the present stem in the active voice, according to the rule: “The passive is formed by adding the passive endings to the present stem in the active voice.”🔽The forms hehinti, hehissanti, hohinti, hohissanti, etc., are formed by the addition of the passive endings to the present stem in the active voice, according to the rule: “The passive is formed by adding the passive endings to the present stem in the active voice.”

original: Hehinti hehissanti, hohinti hohissanti iccādi. Anajjatane īmhi añāgamo, “paro kvacī”ti
analyzed: hehinti hehissanti hohinti hohissanti iccādi an ajjatane īmhi añ āgamaḥ paraḥ kvaci iti
translated: In the passive, the forms hessati, hessanti, etc., are formed by the addition of the passive endings to the present stem in the active voice, according to the rule: “The passive is formed by adding the passive endings to the present stem in the active voice.”

original: īssa lopo, so ahu. Vuddhimhi “dīghā īssa” iti īssa siādeso, suvo ahosi ānando.
analyzed: īssa lopaḥ saḥ ahu vuddhimhi dīghā īssa iti īssa si ādeso suvaḥ ahosi ānando
translated: In the past tense, the form of the verb is īssa, which becomes so. In the future tense, the form of the verb is īssa, which becomes siādeso. Suvo ahosi ānando.

original: 41. Hūto resuṃ
analyzed: hūtaḥ resum
translated: Hūto resuṃ

original: Hūto parassa u+miccassa resuṃ vā hoti. Rakārānubandho “rānubandhentasarādissā”ti antasarādissa lopo. Ahesuṃ. Okāravuddhi avādese ahavuṃ. Ossa siādese ahosi.
analyzed: parassa um iccassa vā hoti rakāra anubandhaḥ anta sa ra ādissa ati anta sa ra ādissa lopaḥ okāra vuddhi ava ādese ahavum ossa si ādese ahosi
translated: Hūto becomes resuṃ or vā in the past tense of the verb of another. The ra is followed by another consonant, so the i is elided by the rule “The i is elided in the middle of a word that ends in a consonant”. Ahesuṃ. The vowel is lengthened in the optative. In the optative, the form is ahavuṃ. In the past tense, the form of the verb is īssa, which becomes ahosi.

original: 46. Iṃssa ca siña
analyzed: iṃssa ca siña
translated: Iṃssa ca siña

original: Imiccassa siña hoti mhātthānañca bahulaṃ. Ñākāro ākhyāvayavattho (ukāro) ikāro uccāraṇattho.
analyzed: im iccassa siña hoti mha atthānam ca bahulam ñākāraḥ ākhyā avayava tthaḥ ukāraḥ ikāraḥ uccāraṇa tthaḥ
translated: Imiccassa siña hoti mhātthānañca bahulaṃ. The ñ is for the purpose of indicating the vowel a (the ākhyāta ending in a). The i is for the purpose of pronunciation.

original: “Aīssā” dinā iñāgame tumhe ahosittha, ahosi. Parassaralope rasse ca ahuṃ, ahosimha,
analyzed: a īssā dinā iñ āgame tumhe ahosittha ahosi parassara lope rasse ca ahum ahosimha
translated: In the past tense, the form of the verb is īssā, which becomes iñāgame. Tumhe ahosittha, ahosi. In the past tense of the verb of another, the ra is elided, and the form is ahuṃ, ahosimha,

original: ahumha, rasso. Bhāve-abhavi, āssatthādeso, abhavittha. Anajjatane āūādipaccaye kate🔽“yuvaṇṇāna+miya ṅuvaṅa sare”ti uvaṅādese ahuvā, ahuvu, ahuvo, ahuvattha. Assa amādese
analyzed: ahumha rassaḥ bhāve abhavi āssa ttha ādesaḥ abhavittha an ajja tane āū ādi paccaye kate  yuva ṇ ānamiya ṅu vaṅa sara iti uvaṅ ādese ahuvā ahuvu ahuvaḥ ahuvattha assa am ādese
translated: ahumha, rasso. In the future tense, the form is abhavi, āssatthādeso, abhavittha. When the suffix āū is added,

original: ahuṃ ahuvaṃ, ahumha iccādi. Bhāve-tena ahuyi ahuyittha. Ahavissā, ahavissaṃsu iccādi.
analyzed: ahum ahuvam ahumhe iccādi bhāvetena ahuyi ahuyittha ahavissā ahavissaṃsu iccādi
translated: by the rule “The u is changed to ū in the middle of a word that ends in a consonant”, the form becomes ahuvā, ahuvu, ahuvo, ahuvattha. In the future tense of the verb of another, the form is ahuṃ, ahuvaṃ, ahumha, etc. In the future tense, the form is ahuyi, ahuyittha. In the future perfect tense, the forms are ahavissā, ahavissaṃsu, etc.

original: Bhāve-ahuyissa, ahuyissatha. Pubbassaralopo, heyya, heyyuṃ iccādi. Bhāve-hūyeyya,

translated: In the future: ahuyissa, ahuyissatha. The elision of the first syllable: heyya, heyyum. In the future: hūyeyya,

original: yojetabbaṃ. Bhāve rūpābhāvā. Kamme-anubhūyati iccādi viseso.

analyzed: paresam sa ādayaḥ honti yathākkamam para rūpe saḥ assa  te assu tvam assa tumhe assatha aham assam mayam assāma tva ādimhi saḥ atu assa

translated: they would be. You are, you all are. I am, we are. In the tvadi (group) he is, they are. In the elision of the final, they are. In the absence of the ādes, you are, you all are. I am, we are. In the ādes, I am, we are. By the force of the bahula (rule),

translated: Brūto parassa tissa īña or vā is added. In the ādes, in the elision of the final, he speaks.

analyzed: āhā paresam ti antīnam ṭa ṭū honti ṭakārāḥ sabba ādesa atthāḥ āhā paresam ti antīnam
translated: The ṭa and ṭū are substituted for the final of the 3rd-declension. The ṭa is the substitute for all the finals. Therefore, the ṭa and ṭū are substituted for the final of the 3rd-declension.

original: Bravissati. Abravi abravī, abravuṃ. Anajjatane abravā, abravu. Parokkhāyaṃ –🔽16. Aādīsvā+ho brūssa
analyzed: bravissati abravi abravī abravum anajjatane abravā abravu parokkhāyam  brūssa

original: Brūssa āho hoti parokkhāaādīsu. Supine kira so āha, te āhu iccādi. Abravissa. Brave braveyya. Vuddhippaṭisedhe brūtu, bravantu iccādi.

original: Hana=hiṃsāyaṃ, timhi vikaraṇalope so hanati hanti. Te hananti iccādi. Kamme-ye nassa ññe pubbarūpaṃ, tena haññati, haññanti haññare. Tathā hanissati iccādi.🔽67. Hanā cha+khā

translated: Hana=hiṃsāyaṃ, timhi vikaraṇalope so hanati hanti. Te hananti, etc. In the passive, the initial vowel is changed to ññe. Therefore, he is killed, they are killed, they are killed. Likewise, hanissati, etc.

original: Hanā ssāssa cha+khā vā honti. Paṭihaṃkhāmi paṭihanissāmi. Haṃchema hanissāma. Ahani, ahaniṃsūtiādi sabbattha yojetabbaṃ. Huvādayo🔽Hu=havane. Tyādīsu lo. “Parokkhāyañcā”ti caggahaṇena hu huti dvittaṃ, “kavaggahānaṃ🔽cavaggajā”ti hassa jo, lalopo vuddhi ca, juhoti aggiṃ, aññatra “yavā sare”ti vakāro,

translated: The forms of the first are: ahani, ahaniṃ, ahaniṃsu, etc.🔽Hu = to offer. The v is elided, and there is augment. The form is juhoti. Except in the case of yavā sare, the v is elided.

analyzed: ssādi eyyādi tva ādīsupi ñeyyā
translated: Ssādi+eyyādi+tvādīsupi ñeyyā.

original: Dā=dāne, dvibhāvarassattāni, lalopo, dadāti, dadanti iccādi. “Gamavadā” dinā dajjādese dajjati, dajjanti iccādi. Lasse+kāre dānaṃ deti iccādi.
analyzed: dā dāne dvi bhāva raḥ sattāni la lopaḥ dadāti dadanti iti ādi gama vadā dinā dajja ādese dajjati dajjanti iti ādi laḥ sa īkāre dānam deti iti ādi
translated: Dā=dāne, dvibhāvarassattāni, lalopo, dadāti, dadanti, etc. “Gamavadā” (P. 1. 1. 1) = dajjādese dajjati, dajjanti, etc. Lasse+kāre dānaṃ deti, etc.

original: 22. Dāssa daṃ vā mimesva+dvitte
analyzed: dāssa dam vā
translated: . Dāssa daṃ vā mimesva+dvitte

original: Advitte vattamānassa dāssa daṃ hoti vā mimesu. Vaggantaṃ, dammi demi, damma dema.
analyzed: a dvitte vattamānassa dāssa dam hoti vā mimesu vaggantam dammi demi damma dema
translated: Advitte vattamānassa dāssa daṃ hoti vā mimesu. Vaggantaṃ, dammi demi, damma dema.

analyzed: adāsi adaṃsu adadu kāla atipattiyam adadissa adajjissa le adassa  dassan su eyya ādimhi dade dadeyya dajje dajjeyya ṭāti bahula adhikārā dajja ādesā parassa  dajjā dajjum dajjeyyam dadeyyum tvādīsu dadātu dadantu dajjatu dajjantu

In the passive: He is given, they are given. In the passive potential: He might be given, they might be given. In the passive optative: Let him be given, let them be given.

original: paridahessati. Adhāsi, pidahi. Adhassa, pidahissa. Dadhe dadheyya, pidahe pidaheyya.
analyzed: paridahessati adhāsi pidahi adhassa pidahissa dadhe dadheyya pidahe pidaheyya
translated: will obstruct. He obstructed, he closed. He obstructed, he will obstruct. He closed, he might close. He might close, he might obstruct.

original: Dadātu, pidahatu, nidhetu, nidhentu iccādi. (Juhotyādayo).
analyzed: dadātu pidahatu nidhetu nidhentu it ca ādi juhoti ādayaḥ
translated: Let him give, let him obstruct, let him place, let them place, etc. (Juhotyādayo).

original: Bhūvādi ca juhādi ca, huvādidhātavo ci+me;
analyzed: bhū ādi ca juh ādi ca hu vādi dhātavaḥ cime
translated: The Bhūvādi and Juhādi, and the Huvādi roots, are these;

original: Savuddhikabhūvādīhi, tidhā bhedaṃ upenti te.
analyzed: tidhā bhedam upenti te
translated: They take the division into three by the Bhūvādi with augment, etc.

original: (Bhūvādinayo.)
analyzed: bhū ādi nayoḥ
translated: (The Bhūvādi system.)

original: Adhunā vikaraṇapabhedapakāsanatthaṃ rudhādīnaṃ aṭṭhagaṇānaṃ kānici rūpāni udāhariyante –
analyzed: adhunā vikaraṇa pabheda pakāsana ttham rudhā ādīnam aṭṭhagaṇānam kānici rūpāni udāhariyante
translated: Now, in order to point out the division of the verbal roots, some forms of the eight groups beginning with Rudh are cited:

original: Rudha=āvaraṇe, tyādayo honti. Eva+muparipi sabbagaṇesu.
analyzed: rudha āvaraṇe tya ādayaḥ honti evam upari pi sa bbagaṇesu
translated: Rudh = to obstruct, etc. are. So too in all the groups.

original: 5,19. Mañca rudhādīnaṃ
analyzed: mañca rudhā dīnam
translated: Now, in the case of Rudh and the others,

original: Rudhādiko aparokkhesu kattuvihitamāna+nta+tyādīsu lo hoti mañca+ntasarā paro. Niggahītassa
analyzed: rudh ādikaḥ aparokkhesu kattu vihita mānanta tya ādīsu laḥ hoti mañcanta sarā paraḥ niggahītassa
translated: In the Aorists, etc., with the active ending -a, the syllable lo is in the place of the final of the root, and the syllable mañca is in the place of the final of the augment.

original: vaggantaṃ, “lahussupantassā”ti saṃyogattā na vuddhi. So maggaṃ rundhati, rundhanti
analyzed: saṃyoga ttā na saḥ maggam rundhati rundhanti
translated: The vowel of the augment is not lengthened because of the combination “of one who is sleeping lightly”. He obstructed the path, they obstructed.

original: iccādi. Kamme-nipubbo kyo dhassa cavagga+pubbarūpa+tatiyakkharajakārā, tena maggo
analyzed: i ca ādi kamme nipubbaḥ kyaḥ dhassa ca vagga pubba rūpa tatiya kkhara ja kārā tena maggaḥ
translated: In the passive, the syllable kyo is in the place of the final of the root, and the syllable avagga is in the place of the first syllable of the augment, and the third syllable of the root has the vowel-change. Therefore the path was obstructed,

original: nirujjhati iccādi. Iñāgame rundhissati, nirujjhissati. Arundhi, arundhiṃsu. Nirujjhittho,
analyzed: nirujjhati it ca ādi iñ āgame rundhissati nirujjhissati arundhi arundhiṃsu nirujjhitthaḥ
translated: The future is formed by adding -i to the present stem, as in rundhissati, nirujjhissati. The past is formed by adding -i to the present stem, as in arundhi, arundhiṃsu. The future passive participle is formed by adding -ttho to the present stem, as in nirujjhittho,

original: nirujjhi, nirujjhiṃsu. Arundhissa, arundhissaṃsu, nirujjhissa, nirujjhissaṃsu. Rundhe🔽rundheyya, nirujjhe nirujjheyya. Rundhatu, rundhantu. Tvaṃ rundha rundhāhi. Nirujjhatu, nirujjhantu iccādi.
analyzed: nirujjhi nirujjhiṃsu arundhissa arundhissaṃsu nirujjhissaṃsu nirujjhissaṃsu rundhe  rundheyya nirujjhe nirujjheyya rundhatu rundhantu tvam rundha rundhāhi nirujjhatu nirujjhantu iccādi
translated: nirujjhi, nirujjhiṃsu. The future passive participle is formed by adding -ttho to the present stem, as in arundhissa, arundhissaṃsu, nirujjhissa, nirujjhissaṃsu. The present is formed by adding -e to the present stem, as in rundhe,🔽rundheyya, nirujjhe, nirujjheyya. The present is formed by adding -e to the present stem, as in rundhatu, rundhantu, tvaṃ rundha, rundhāhi, nirujjhatu, nirujjhantu.

original: Chida=dvedhākaraṇe, chindati, chindanti. Kamme-chijjati, chijjanti. Bhavissatipaccaye
analyzed: chida dvedhā karaṇe chindati chindanti kamme chijjati chijjanti bhavissati paccaye
translated: The future is formed by adding -i to the present stem, as in chindati, chindanti. In the passive voice, the future is formed by adding -jja, -jjanti, as in chijjati, chijjanti. The future passive participle is formed by adding -ttho to the present stem, as in bhavissatipaccaye.

original: – “labha vasacchidā” dinā cchaṅādese checchati chindissati. Kamme-pubbarūpaṃ, chijjissati,🔽chijjissanti. Achindi chindi, acchejji, acchejjiṃsu. Acchindissā achijjissā. Chinde
analyzed: labha vasa chidā dinā chaṅ ādese checchati chindissati kammepubbarūpam chijjissati  chijjissanti achindi chindi acchejji acchejjiṃsu acchindissā achijjissā chinde
translated: The future passive participle is formed by adding -ttho to the present stem, as in “labha vasacchidā” dinā cchaṅādese checchati chindissati. The future passive participle is formed by adding -ttho to the present stem, as in pubbarūpaṃ, chijjissati,🔽chijjissanti. The past is formed by adding -i to the present stem, as in achindi, chindi, acchejji, acchejjiṃsu. The past is formed by adding -i to the present stem, as in acchajjissā, achijjissā. The past is formed by adding -i to the present stem, as in chinde,

original: chindeyya, chijje chijjeyya, chindatu, chindantu, chijjatu, chijjantu iccādi.
analyzed: chindeyya chijje chijjeyya chindatu chindantu chijjatu chijjantu iccādi
translated: chindeyya, chijje, chijjeyya, chindatu, chindantu, chijjatu, chijjantu.

original: Bhuja=pālanajjhohāresu, bhuñjati, bhuñjanti iccādi. Bhavissatimhi “bhuja+muca+vaca+visānaṃ
analyzed: bhuja pālana jhohāresu bhuñjati bhuñjanti iccādi bhavissatimhi
translated: Bhuja = in the senses of ‘to protect’ and ‘to eat’, he eats, they eat, etc. In the future tense, ‘bhuja + muca + vaca + visānaṃ

original: kkhaṅa”ti dhātvantena saha ssassa kkhaṅādese vuddhi, bhokkhati, bhuñjissati, bhokkhanti,🔽bhuñjissanti iccādi.
analyzed: dhātu antena saha ssassa kkhaṅ ādese bhokkhati bhuñjissati bhokkhanti  bhuñjissanti iccādi
translated: kkhaṅa’ (Pā. 1.1.65), the augment kkhaṅ is added to the root, and the augment vuddhi is added to the ss of the root, he will eat, they will eat, etc.

original: Muca=mocane, muccati, muccanti iccādi. Kamme-muccati, muccanti iccādi. (Rudhādinayo).
analyzed: muca mocane muccati muccanti iccādi
translated: Muca = in the sense of ‘to release’, he is released, they are released, etc. In the passive voice, he is released, they are released, etc. (The ‘Rudha’ group).

original: Diva=kīḷā vijigiṃsā vohāra juti thuti gatīsu,
analyzed: divakīḷā vijigiṃsā vohāra juti thuti gatīsu
translated: Diva = in the senses of ‘play’, ‘desire to conquer’, ‘communication’, ‘light’, ‘praise’, and ‘going’,

original: 5,21. Divādīhi yaka
analyzed: divā dīhi yaka
translated: . With diva, etc., yaka

original: Divādīhi kattari lavisaye yaka hoti. Kakāro kānubandhakāriyattho, eva+mupari ca.🔽Vassa bakāre pubbarūpaṃ, so jutaṃ dibbati, dibbanti iccādi. Kamme-kye tena dibbati,🔽dibbanti iccādi. Dibbissati, tena dibbissati. Adibbi dibbi. Tena adibbi dibbi. Adibbissa.
analyzed: diva ādīhi kattari la visaye ya ka hoti kakāraḥ evam upari ca  vassa bakāre pubbarūpam saḥ jutam dibbati dibbanti iccādi kammekye tena dibbati  dibbanti iccādi dibbissati tena dibbissati adibbi dibbi tena adibbi dibbi adibbissa
translated: With diva, etc., yaka is used in the sense of the active voice. The letter ka has the meaning of ‘connection’ and ‘doing’, and so does the letter u above.🔽The vowel a is the initial vowel, he plays, they play, etc. In the passive voice, by that he is played,🔽they are played, etc. He will play, by that he will play. He did not play, he played. By that he did not play, he played. He will not play.

original: Tena adibbissa. Dibbe dibbeyya. Tena dibbe dibbeyya. Dibbatu. Tena dibbatu iccādi.
analyzed: tena adibbissa dibbe dibbeyya tena dibbe dibbeyya dibbatu tena dibbatu iccādi
translated: By that he will not play. He would play, he would play. By that he would play. He played, he played. By that he played.

original: Siva=tantusantāne, sibbati, sibbanti iccādi. Pada=gamane, upubbo, cavaggapubbarūpāni,
analyzed: siva tantu santāne sibbati sibbanti iccādi pada gamane u pubbaḥ ca vagga pubba rūpāni
translated: Siva = in a series of threads, it weaves, they weave, etc. Pada = in going, the prefix, the form of the prefix cavagga,

original: uppajjati, uppajjare uppajjanti iccādi. Kammekye tena paṭipajjate iccādi. Bhāve-uppajjate🔽tayā. Budha=avagamane, jhakārapubbarūpāni yakkharesu. Dhammaṃ bujjhati, bujjhare
analyzed: uppajjati uppajjare uppajjanti iccādi kammekye tena paṭipajjate iccādi bhāve uppajjate  tayā budha avagamane jhakāra pubbarūpāni yakkharesu dhammam bujjhati bujjhare
translated: Siva = in a series of threads, it weaves, they weave, etc. Pada = in going, it goes, they go, etc. In the kammadhāraya compound, it is used in the sense of “one who practices by that,” etc. In the bhāva, it is used in the sense of “arises by that,” etc.

original: bujjhanti iccādi. Kamme-mayā dhammo bujjhate iccādi. Yudha=sampahāre, yujjhati+ccādi.🔽Naha=bandhane, “hassa vipallāso”ti ye vipallāso, sannayhati+ccādi. Mana=ñāṇe, ññakāra+pubbarūpāni,
analyzed: bujjhanti iccādi dhammaḥ bujjhate iccādi yudha sampahāre yujjhati iccādi  naha bandhane hassa vipallāsaḥ iti ye vipallāsaḥ san nayha ticca ādi mana ñāṇe ññakāra pubbarūpāni
translated: Budha = in understanding, it understands, they understand, etc. In the kamma, it is used in the sense of “the Dhamma is understood by me,” etc. Yudha = in striking, it fights, etc.

original: maññati+ccādi. Tusa=tuṭṭhimhi, pubbarūpe tussati+ccādi. Sama=upasame, sammati+ccādi.
analyzed: mañña ti cca ādi tus a tuṭṭhimhi pubba rūpe tussati cca ādi sama upasame samma ti cca ādi
translated: Naha = in binding, it is bound, etc. Mana = in knowing, it thinks, etc. Tusa = in satisfaction, it is satisfied, etc. Sama = in tranquility, it is tranquil, etc.

original: Jana=janane, “janissā”ti ā hoti kānubandhe bahulādhikārā, so jāyati, jāyanti+ccādi.🔽Kamme-janituṃ payojetīti “payojakabyāpāre ṇāpi ce”ti ṇimhi “aññatrāpī”ti vuddhipaṭisedhe
analyzed: jana janane ā hoti ka anubandhe bahula adhikārā saḥ jāyati jāyanti ccādi 🔽payojeti iti payojaka byāpāre ca iti ṇimhi aññatra api iti vuddhi paṭisedhe
translated: Jana = in producing, it is born, they are born, etc. In the kamma, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc.🔽In the kammadhāraya compound, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In the bhāva, it is used in the sense of “one who is born,” etc. In the kamma, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In the kammadhāraya compound, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In the bhāva, it is used in the sense of “one who is born,” etc. In the kamma, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In the kammadhāraya compound, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In the bhāva, it is used in the sense of “one who is born,” etc. In the kamma, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In the kammadhāraya compound, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In the bhāva, it is used in the sense of “one who is born,” etc. In the kamma, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In the kammadhāraya compound, it is used in the sense of “one who causes to be born,” etc. In

original: kyamhi “dīgho sarassā”ti dīghe ca kate tena janīyati, janīyanti iccādi. So jāyissati.
analyzed: kyamhi dīghaḥ sarassāti dīghe ca kate tena janīyati janīyanti iccādi saḥ jāyissati
translated: In the sense of “long,” the form is “dīghassa,” and the verb is “janīyati,” “janīyanti,” etc. He will be born.

original: Tena janissati. So ajāyi, tena ajanīyi. So ajāyissa, tena ajanīyissa. So jāye jāyeyya,
analyzed: tena janissati saḥ ajāyi tena ajanīyi saḥ ajāyissa tena ajanīyissa saḥ jāye jāyeyya
translated: By him he will be born. He was born. By him he was born. He will be born. By him he will be born. He will be born. He will be born.

original: tena janīyeyya. So jāyatu, tena janīyatu iccādi. (Divādinayo).
analyzed: saḥ jāyatu tena janīyatu iccādi
translated: By him he will be born. He may be born. By him he may be born. (The same as the foregoing.)

original: Tuda=byathane,🔽5,22. Tudādīhi ko
analyzed: tuda byathane  tud ādi ī hi kaḥ
translated: Tuda = to strike.🔽Ko is used with tudā, etc.,

original: Tudādīhi kattari lavisaye ko hoti. Tudati, tudanti iccādi. Kamme-tudyati tujjati,🔽tudyare tudyanti, tujjare tujjanti+ccādi. Tathā tudissati tujjissati. Atudi, atudiṃsu,🔽atujji. Atudissa atujjissa, tudeyya tujjeyya. Tudatu, tudantu, tujjatu iccādi.
analyzed: tud ādīhi kattari la visaye kaḥ hoti tudati tudanti iti ādi  tudyare tudyanti tujjare tujjanticca ādi tathā tudissati tujjissati a tudi a tudiṃsu  a tujji a tudissa a tujjissa tudeyya tujjeyya tudatu tudantu tujjatu iccādi
translated: Ko is used in the passive sense with tudā, etc. He is struck, they are struck. In the causative sense: He causes to be struck, they cause to be struck.🔽They will cause to be struck, they will cause to be struck. He caused to be struck, they caused to be struck.🔽He caused to be struck, they caused to be struck. He will cause to be struck, they will cause to be struck. He might cause to be struck, they might cause to be struck. He might cause to be struck, they might cause to be struck. He might cause to be struck, they might cause to be struck.

original: Visa=pavesane, papubbo. So gāmaṃ pavisati iccādi. Kamme-pavisīyati iccādi. Pavisissati.🔽Pavisīyissati. Pāvisi, īmhi “bhujamucā” dinā yogavibhāgā kkhaṅa. Pāvisi, pavisi pāvekkhi,
analyzed: visa pavesane so gāmam pavisati iccādi iccādi pavisissati 🔽pavisīyissati pāvisi īmhi bhuja mucā dinā yogavibhāgā kkhaṅa pāvisi pavisi pāvekkhi
translated: Visa = to enter, to penetrate. He enters the village, etc. In the causative sense: He causes to enter, etc. He will enter.🔽He will cause to enter. He entered, they entered. In the passive sense: He is caused to enter, they are caused to enter. He entered, he entered, he entered.🔽He entered, he entered, he entered. He will enter, he will enter. He might enter, he might enter.

original: pathaviṃ pāvisiṃsu pavisiṃsu. Pāvisīyi. Pāvisissa pavisissa. Pāvisīyissa. Pavise
analyzed: pathavim pāvisiṃsu pavisiṃsu pāvisīyi pāvisissa pavisissa pāvisīyissa pavise
translated: They entered the earth, they entered. He entered. He will enter. He would enter. He would enter.

original: paviseyya, vikaraṇalopo pavisīyeyya. Pavisatu, pavisīyatu iccādi. Nudati. Disa=uccāraṇe,
analyzed: paviseyya vikaraṇa lopaḥ pavisīyeyya pavisatu pavisīyatu iccādi nudati disā uccāraṇe
translated: He would enter, the vikaraṇa is elided. He would enter. Let him enter. Let him enter. Thus, etc. He drives away. Disa = uccāraṇe,

original: uddissati, likhati, tusati iccādi. (Tudādinayo).
analyzed: uddissati likhati tusati iccādi tud ādi nayaḥ
translated: He aims, he writes, he is satisfied, etc. (Tudādinayo).

original: Ji=jaye,
analyzed: jijaye
translated: Ji = jaye,

original: 5,23. Jyādīhi knā
analyzed: jyā ādīhi knā
translated: . Jyādīhi knā

original: Jyādīhi kattari lavisaye knā hoti. Na vuddhi. Kilese jināti, jinanti. Tena kileso
analyzed: jyā ādīhi kattari la visaye hoti na kilesaḥ jināti jinanti tena kilesaḥ
translated: Jyādīhi kattari lavisaye knā hoti. Na vuddhi. He conquers defilements, they conquer. By that defilement

original: jīyati, jīyanti, kye dīgho. Jinissati, jinissanti. Ajini jini. Ajīyi, ajīyittha.
analyzed: jīyati jīyanti kye dīghaḥ jinissati jinissanti ajini jini ajīyi ajīyittha
translated: is conquered, are conquered. Kye is long. He will conquer, they will conquer. He conquered, they conquered. He did not conquer, they did not conquer.

original: Ajinissa. Ajīyissa. Jineyya. Jinātu iccādi. Ci=caye, tathā cināti, cinanti iccādi.
analyzed: ajinissa ajīyissa jineyya jinātu iccādi cicaye tathā cināti cinanti iccādi
translated: He would not conquer, he would not conquer. He would conquer. Let him conquer, etc. Ci = caṃye, thus he collects, they collect, etc.

original: Ñā=avabodhane,
analyzed: ñā avabodhane
translated: Ñā = avabodhane,

original: 5,120. Ñāssa ne jā
analyzed: ñāssa ne jā
translated: . Ñāssa ne jā

original: Ñādhātussa jā hoti nakāre. Vijānāti.
analyzed: ñā dhātuḥ sa jā hoti nakāre vijānāti
translated: Ñādhātussa jā hoti nakāre. He cognizes.

original: 61. Ñāssa sanāssa nāyo timhi
analyzed: ñāssa sa nāssa nāyaḥ timhi
translated: . Ñāssa sanāssa nāyo timhi

original: Sanāssa ñāssa nāyo vā hoti timhi. Nāyati, vijānāti iccādi. Kamme-viññāyati iccādi.
analyzed: sa nāssa ñāssa nāyaḥ vā hoti timhi nāyati vijānāti iccādi
translated: Sanāssa ñāssa nāyo vā hoti timhi. He leads, he cognizes, etc. In the passive - he is cognized, etc.

original: Kye “āsse cā”ti ettha “āsse”ti yogavibhāgā āssa e hoti, yassa dvitte ñeyyati, ñeyyanti🔽iccādi. Vijānissati, vijānissanti. Kamme – “kyassa sse”ti kyalope rasse ca kate ñāssati,
analyzed: kye āsse ca ati ettha āsse iti yogavibhāgāḥ āsse hoti yassa  iccādi vijānissati vijānissanti kamme kyassa ssa iti kya lope rasse ca kate
translated: Kye: “āsse cā” means that in the case of āsse, āssa becomes e, and ñeyyati, ñeyyanti is known.

original: ñāssanti, viññāyissati, paññāyissati.
analyzed: ñāssanti viññāyissati paññāyissati
translated: Vijānissati, vijānissanti. In the verb: “kyassa sse” means that when ky is elided and rasse is made, ñāssati, ñāssanti, viññāyissati, paññāyissati is known.

original: 65. Ssassa hi kamme
analyzed: ssassa hi kamme
translated: . Ssassa hi kamme

original: Ñāto parassa ssassa hi vā hoti kamme, paññāyihiti, paññāyihinti. Añāgame samajāni, saṃjāni, saṃjāniṃsu. Samajā- niṃsu. Kamme-paññāyi, paññāyiṃsu. Ajānissa. Kamme-aññāyissa.
analyzed: ñā taḥ parassa ssassa hi vā hoti kamme paññāyihiti paññāyihinti añ āgame samajāni saṃjāni saṃjāniṃsu samajāniṃsu kamme paññāyi paññāyiṃsu ajānissa kamme aññāyissa
translated: Ñāto parassa ssassa hi vā is known in the verb, paññāyihiti, paññāyihinti. In the aorists: samajāni, saṃjāni, saṃjāniṃsu. Samajā-niṃsu. In the verb: paññāyi, paññāyiṃsu. Ajānissa. In the verb: aññāyissa.

original: 63. Eyyassi+yāñā vā
analyzed: ey yas siya āñāḥ vā
translated: . Eyyassi+yāñā vā

original: Ñāto parassa eyyassa iyā+ñā honti vā. Jāniyā.
analyzed: ñā taḥ parassa eyyassa iyāñā honti vā jāniyā
translated: Ñāto parassa eyyassa iyā+ñā are known optionally. Jāniyā.

original: 62. Ñāmhi jaṃ
analyzed: ñāmhi jam
translated: . Ñāmhi jaṃ

original: Ñādese sanāssa ñāssa jaṃ vā hoti. Jaññā, jāneyya, jāneyyuṃ. Kamme-paññāyeyya, paññāyeyyuṃ. Vijānātu, vijānanthu. Kamme-viññāyatu iccādi.
analyzed: ña ādese sa na āssa ña assa jam vā hoti jaññā jāneyya jāneyyum kamme paññāyeyya paññāyeyyum vijānātu vijānanthu kamme viññāyatu iccādi
translated: In the optative, sanāssa ñāssa jaṃ is known optionally. Jaññā, jāneyya, jāneyyuṃ. In the verb: paññāyeyya, paññāyeyyuṃ. Vijānātu, vijānanthu. In the verb: viññāyatu, etc.

original: Mā=māne, “ā ī ssādīnaṃ byañjanassiña” iti iñaiti yogavibhāgā iñāgame pubbasaralopo,
analyzed: ā ī ssa ādīnam byañjanaḥ iñaḥ iti iñaḥ eti yogavibhāgāḥ iñ āgame pubba sara lopaḥ
translated: Mā=māne, “ā ī ssādīnaṃ byañjanassiña” iti iñaiti yogavibhāgā iñāgame pubbasaralopo,

analyzed: mināti minanti iccādi lū chedane dhātussa
translated: mināti, minanti. Kamme-mīyati iccādi. Lū=chedane, “kṇāknāsu rasso”ti dhātussa rasso,

original: lunāti, lunanti. Kamme-lūyati iccādi. Dhu=kampane, dhunāti iccādi. (Jyādinayo).
analyzed: lunāti lunanti kammelūyati iccādi dhu kampane dhunāti iccādi
translated: lunāti, lunanti. Kamme-lūyati iccādi. Dhu=kampane, dhunāti iccādi. (Jyādinayo).

original: Kī=dabbavinīmaye,
analyzed: kīdap ba vi nīmaye
translated: Kī=dabbavinīmaye,

analyzed: kya ādi hi kṇā
translated: . Kyādīhi kṇā

analyzed: kya ādīhi la visaye kṇā hoti kṇā knāsu rassoti rasse kiṇāti kiṇanti iccādi
translated: Kyādīhi lavisaye kṇā hoti. “Kṇāknāsu rasso”ti rasse kiṇāti, kiṇanti iccādi. Kamme-vikkīyati,

original: vikkīyanti. Vikkiṇissati, vikkiṇissanti. Vikkīyissati, vikkīyissanti. Akiṇi, vikkiṇi,
analyzed: vikkīyanti vikkiṇissati vikkiṇissanti vikkīyissati vikkīyissanti akiṇi vikkiṇi
translated: vikkīyanti. Vikkiṇissati, vikkiṇissanti. Vikkīyissati, vikkīyissanti. Akiṇi, vikkiṇi,

analyzed: vikkīyi akiṇissa vikkiṇissa vikkiṇe vikkiṇeyya
translated: vikkīyi. Akiṇissa, vikkiṇissa. Vikkiṇe vikkiṇeyya.

original: Vikkīye. Vikkīyeyya. Vikkiṇātu, vikkiṇantu, vikkīyatu, vikkīyantu iccādi. Su=savane, suṇāti, suṇanti iccādi.
analyzed: vikkīye vikkīyeyya vikkiṇātu vikkiṇantu vikkīyatu vikkīyantu iccādi su savane suṇāti suṇanti iccādi
translated: Vikkīye. Vikkīyeyya. Vikkiṇātu, vikkiṇantu, vikkīyatu, vikkīyantu iccādi. Su=savane, suṇāti, suṇanti iccādi.

original: Saka=sattiyaṃ,
analyzed: sakasattiyam
translated: Saka=sattiyaṃ,

analyzed: sakaāpānam kukakuicca ite āgamāḥ honti ṇe sakkuṇāti sakkuṇanti sakkunāti sakkunanti
translated: The aorist forms of these verbs are: sakā+pānaṃ kuka+kuiccete āgamā honti ṇe. Sakkuṇāti, sakkuṇanti. Sakkunāti, sakkunanti.

original: 53. Sse vā
analyzed: s se vā
translated: . Sse vā

analyzed: sakasmā kṇa assa kkhaḥ vā hoti sse sakkhissati sakkhissanti
translated: Sakasmā kṇāssa kkho vā hoti sse. Sakkhissati, sakkhissanti.

original: 58. Sakā kṇāssa kha īādo
analyzed: sakā kṇa assa khaḥ ī ādaḥ
translated: . Sakā kṇāssa kha īādo

original: Sakasmā kṇāssa kho vā hoti īādīsu. Asakkhi sakkhi, sakkhiṃsu. Asakkhissa, asakkhissaṃsu. Sakkuṇe sakkuṇeyya. Sakkuṇātu, sakkuṇantu.
analyzed: sakasmā kho vā hoti ī ādīsu asakkhi sakkhi sakkhiṃsu asakkhissa asakkhissaṃsu sakkuṇe sakkuṇeyya sakkuṇātu sakkuṇantu
translated: Sakasmā kṇāssa kho vā hoti īādīsu. Asakkhi sakkhi, sakkhiṃsu. Asakkhissa, asakkhissaṃsu. Sakkuṇe sakkuṇeyya. Sakkuṇātu, sakkuṇantu.

analyzed: apapāpuṇane saka apānam sampatti pāpuṇāti pāpuṇanti
translated: Apa=pāpuṇane, papubbo, “sakā+pānaṃ kuka+ku ṇe”ti kukate sampatti pāpuṇāti, pāpuṇanti

original: iccādi. Kammepāpīyati, pāpīyanti. Pāpuṇissati, pāpuṇissanti. Kamme-pāpīyissati, pāpīyissanti.
analyzed: iccādi kamme pāpīyati pāpīyanti pāpuṇissati pāpuṇissanti kamme pāpīyissati pāpīyissanti
translated: iccādi. Pāpīyati, pāpīyanti. Pāpuṇissati, pāpuṇissanti. Pāpīyissati, pāpīyissanti.

original: Pāpuṇi, pāpuṇiṃsu. Kamme-pāpīyi, pāpīyittha. Apāpuṇissa. Kamme-apāpīyissa. Pāpuṇe,
analyzed: pāpuṇi pāpuṇiṃsu kamme pāpīyi pāpīyittha apāpuṇissa kamme apāpīyissa pāpuṇe
translated: Pāpuṇi, pāpuṇiṃsu. Pāpīyi, pāpīyittha. Apāpuṇissa. Apāpīyissa. Pāpuṇe,

original: pāpuṇeyya. Kamme-pāpīyeyya. Pāpuṇātu, pāpuṇantu. Kamme-pāpīyatu iccādi. (Kyādinayo).
analyzed: pāpuṇeyya kamme pāpīyeyya pāpuṇātu pāpuṇantu kamme pāpīyatu iccādi kya ādi nayo
translated: pāpuṇeyya. Pāpīyeyya. Pāpuṇātu, pāpuṇantu. Pāpīyatu iccādi. (Kyādinayo).

original: Su=savane,
analyzed: su savane
translated: Su=savane,

original: 25. Svādīhi kṇo
analyzed: svādīhi kṇo
translated: . Svādīhi kṇo

original: Suādīhi lavisaye kṇo hoti. Kānubandhattā na vuddhi. Dhammaṃ suṇoti. Parassaralope🔽suṇonti. Kamme-kye dīghe sūyati, sūyanti. Dvitte suyyati suyyanti+ccādi. Iñāgame🔽suṇissati, suṇissanti. Kamme-kyalope vuddhi. Sossati, sossanti iccādi. Asuṇi suṇi, asuṇiṃsu suṇiṃsu.
analyzed: su ādīhi la visaye kṇaḥ hoti ka anubandha ttā na dhammam suṇoti parassara lope  suṇonti kammekye dīghe sūyati sūyanti dvitte suyyati suyyanticca ādi iñ āgame  suṇissanti suṇissanti iccādi asuṇi suṇi asuṇiṃsu suṇiṃsu
translated: The augment k is added to su, etc., after a vowel. The augment v is not added because of the following k. He hears the Dhamma. They hear. In the passive, in the causative, the long vowel is lengthened. It is ripened, they are ripened. In the passive, in the causative, the short vowel is lengthened. It is ripened, they are ripened, etc. In the future,

original: 60. Tesu suto kṇo+kṇānaṃ roṭa🔽Tesu īādīsu suto paresaṃ kṇo+kṇānaṃ roṭa vā hoti. Rakāro anubandho. Ṭo sabbādesattho.
analyzed: tesu sutaḥ kṇokṇānam roṭa  tesu ī ādīsu su taḥ paresam kṇa u kṇānam vā hoti rakāraḥ anubandhaḥ ṭaḥ sabba ādesa atthaḥ
translated: he will hear, they will hear. In the passive, in the causative, the augment v is added. It will be ripened, they will be ripened, etc. In the past, he heard, they heard; he caused to hear, they caused to hear.🔽. Among them, the augment k of su is ro or ṭa after other k and k.

original: Ussa lope dvittaṃ īssa si ca. Assosi, assosiṃsu. “Iṃssa ca siña”ti yogavibhāgā siña,🔽assosiṃsu, paccassosuṃ. Asuyi, asuyittha. Asuṇissa, tena asuyissa. Suṇe suṇeyya,
analyzed: ussa lope dvittam īssa si ca assosi assosiṃsu iṃssa ca siñati yogavibhāgā  assosiṃsu asuyittha asuṇissa tena asuyissa suṇe suṇeyya
translated: Among them, the augment k of su is ro or ṭa after other k and k. The letter r is added for the purpose of euphony. In the passive, in the causative, the augment v is added. The augment si is added to ī. He heard, they heard. “The augment si is added to ī” (1.1.61), by the rule of distribution, si is added.🔽They heard, they caused to hear. He caused to hear, they caused to hear. He will hear, he will cause to hear. He may hear, he may cause to hear.

original: suṇeyyaṃ. Tena sūye sūyeyya. Suṇātu, suṇantu. Sūyatu, sūyantu iccādi.
analyzed: suṇeyyam tena sūye sūyeyya suṇātu suṇantu sūyatu sūyantu iccādi
translated: He may hear, he may cause to hear. Let him hear, let them hear. Let him cause to hear, let them cause to hear, etc.

original: Gi=sadde, giṇoti. Giṇanti. Tvaṃ giṇosi. Giṇissati, giṇissanti. Agiṇissa. Giṇeyya. Giṇotu iccādi. Vu=saṃvaraṇe, āvuṇoti, āvuṇanti. Āvuṇosi iccādi. Sesesupi yojetabbaṃ. (Svādinayo).
analyzed: gi sadde giṇoti giṇanti tvam giṇosi giṇissati giṇissanti a giṇissa giṇeyya giṇotu iccādi vu saṃvaraṇe āvuṇoti āvuṇanti āvuṇosi iccādi sesesu pi yojetabbam su ādinayo
translated: Vuṇoti, āvuṇoti, āvuṇanti, āvuṇosi, etc. The rest should be illustrated in the same way. (The “a” is the base.)

original: Tana=vitthāre,🔽26. Tanāditvo
analyzed: tana vitthāre  tan ā t itvaḥ
translated: Tana = to extend,🔽. The “a” is the base

original: Tanādito kattari lavisaye o hoti. Kittiṃ tanoti, tanonti iccādi.
analyzed: tan ādeḥ kattari la visaye o hoti kittim tanoti tanonti icca ādi
translated: In the passive voice, the form of the verb is o, when the object is a person. Kittiṃ tanoti, tanonti, etc.

original: 76. Ovikaraṇassu paracchakke
analyzed: o vikaraṇassu paracchakke
translated: . O is the form of the passive voice, when the object is a person in the locative case

original: Ovikaraṇassa u hoti paracchakkavisaye. Tanute, tanvante. Tanuse, tanuvhe. Tanve, tanvamhe. Kamme –
analyzed: ovikaraṇassa u hoti paracchakka visaye tanute tanvante tanuse tanuvhe tanve tanvamhe kamme
translated: Tanute, tanvante, tanuse, tanuvhe, tanve, tanvamhe. In the passive voice:

original: 5,138. Tanassā vā🔽Tanassa vā ā hoti kye. Papubbo, patāyati. Pataññati, patāyare patāyanti pataññare
analyzed: tanassā vā  tanassa vā ā hoti kye papubbaḥ patāyati pataññati patāyare patāyanti pataññare
translated: . Or ā is the form of the passive voice, when the object is a person in the nominative case

original: pataññanti+ccādi. Tathā vikaraṇalope iñāgame ca tanissati, tanissanti. Patāyissati.
analyzed: tathā vikaraṇa lope iñ āgame ca tanissati tanissanti patāyissati
translated: Papubbo, patāyati, pataññati, patāyare, patāyanti, pataññare, pataññanti, etc. In the same way, when the passive voice is formed by the elision of the passive ending and the addition of iñ, tanissati, tanissanti, patāyissati, etc.

original: Atani, ataniṃsu. Atanissa. Patāyissa. Taneyya, taneyyuṃ. Tanotu, tanontu iccādi.
analyzed: atani ataniṃsu atanissa patāyissa taneyya taneyyum tanotu tanontu iccādi
translated: Atani, ataniṃsu, atanissa, patāyissa, taneyya, taneyyuṃ, tanotu, tanontu, etc.

original: Kara=karaṇe,
analyzed: kara karaṇe
translated: Kara = to do,🔽. The “a” is the base

original: 5,177. Karassa sossa kubba+kuru+kayirā
analyzed: karassa sossa kubba kuru kayirā
translated: Karassa sossa kubba+kuru+kayirā

original: Karassa sa okārassa kubbādayo vā honti nta+māna+tyādīsu. Kubbati, kubbanti. Karoti, karonti. Karosi, karotha.
analyzed: karassa saḥ okārassa kubba ādayaḥ vā honti nta māna ti ādīsu kubbati kubbanti karoti karonti karosi karotha
translated: In nta+māna+tya+etc. the forms kubba+etc. are optionally substituted for the 3rd person singular and plural of karassa sa okārassa. He does, they do. He makes, they make. You do, you all do.

original: 23. Karassa sossa kuṃ
analyzed: karassa sossa kum
translated: . Karassa sossa kuṃ

original: Karassa sa okārassa kuṃ vā hoti mimesu. Kummi karomi. Kumma karoma. Paracchakke kurute
analyzed: karassa saḥ okārassa kum vā hoti kummi karomi kumma karoma parat śakke kurute
translated: In mimesu the form kuṃ is optionally substituted for the 3rd person singular and plural of karassa sa okārassa. I do, we do. I make, we make. He makes in the other’s eye

original: kubbate, kubbante iccādi. Kayirati, kayiranti iccādi. Kamme-kyassa dvitte īssa rasso,🔽kariyyati, karīyati vā iccādi. “Tavaggavaraṇā” dinā ye rassa yakāre kayyati, kayyanti.
analyzed: kubbate kubbante iccādi kayirati kayiranti iccādi kamma ikyassa dvitte īssa rassaḥ  vā iti ādi ta vagga varaṇāḥ dinā ye rassa yakāre
translated: kubbate, kubbante, etc. He will do, they will do, etc. In the passive, the short vowel of kyassa is lengthened by the rule “Tavaggavaraṇā” . It is done, it is made, etc.

original: Bahulādhakārā kamme kvaci iminā kayirādese tena kayirati, kayiranti iccādi. Bhavissatimhi –
analyzed: bahula adhakārā kamme kvaci iminā kayira ādese tena kayiranti icca ādi bhavissatimhi
translated: In the future, by the rule “Bahulādhakārā kamme kvaci” , the form kayirati, kayiranti, etc. is optionally substituted for the forms kayyati, kayyanti, etc. of the passive.

original: 25. Hāssa cā+haṅa ssena
analyzed: hāssa ca ahaṅaḥ ssena
translated: . Hāssa cā+haṅa ssena

original: Karassa sossa hāssa ca āhaṅa vā hoti ssena saha. Kāhati, kāhanti iccādi. Iñāgame kāhiti, kāhinti iccādi. Āhaṅādesābhāvapakkhe karissati, karissanti iccādi. Ajjatane –
analyzed: karassa sossa hāssa ca āhaṅa vā hoti ssena saha kāhati kāhanti iccādi iñ āgame kāhati kāhanti iccādi āhaṅa ādesa abhāva pakkhe karissati karissanti iccādi ajjatane

analyzed: akārassa apayogaḥ khe lahuḥ supantassa ati patta īkārassa aññatra api iti paṭisedhaḥ yakāra vat jita byañjanassa

analyzed: nāmasmā dhātvatthe bahulami hoti hatthinā atikkamati iti i paccaye la vikaraṇa ekāra aya ādesesu

original: 5,13. Saccādīhā+pi🔽Saccādīhi dhātvatthe āpi hoti. Sacca+mācikkhatīti āpimhi tyādipaccaye “ṇi+ṇāpyā+dīhi

original: Evaṃ vedāpayati. Sukkhaṃ karotīti sukkhāpayati sukkhāpeti iccādi.

translated: So too: he causes to be taught, he causes to be taught. He makes dry, he causes to be dried, he causes to be dried.

analyzed: iccādi bhāve bhāveyya iccādi iccādi bhāvayatu bhāvetu iccādi

original: Kamme-bhāvīyatu iccādi.
analyzed: i c ādi
translated: Kamme-bhāvīyatu iccādi.

original: Pacituṃ payojetīti atthe ṇi+ṇāpī honti. So devadattena odanaṃ pācayati pāceti iccādi,
analyzed: pacitum payoja iti iti atthe honti saḥ devadattena odanam pācayati pāca iti iccādi
translated: Pacituṃ payojetīti atthe ṇi+ṇāpī honti. So devadattena odanaṃ pācayati pāceti iccādi,

original: tathā pācāpayati pācāpeti+ccādi. Kamme-so tena devadattena odano pācīyati pācāpīyati+ccādi,
analyzed: tathā pācāpayati pācāpeti ccādi kammeso tena devadattena odano pācīyati pācāpīyati ccādi
translated: tathā pācāpayati pācāpeti+ccādi. Kamme-so tena devadattena odano pācīyati pācāpīyati+ccādi,

original: bhavissatyādīsupi yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: bhavissati ādīsu pi yojetabbam
translated: bhavissatyādīsupi yojetabbaṃ.

original: Gantuṃ payojetīti atthe so taṃ purisaṃ gāmaṃ gamayati gameti gacchāpayati gacchāpeti+ccādi. Kamme-tena so gāmaṃ gamīyati gacchāpīyati+ccādi.
analyzed: gantum payojeti iti atthe saḥ tam purisam gāmam gamayati gameti gaccha āpayati gaccha apa iti ccādi kammetena saḥ gāmam gamīyati gaccha āpīyati ccādi
translated: In the sense of “he causes to go,” it is “he sends him to the village,” “he sends him to the village,” “he causes him to go,” “he causes him to go.” In the passive, “he is sent to the village,” “he is caused to go.”

original: Guha=saṃvaraṇe, guhituṃ payojetīti ṇimhi “guhissa sare”ti dīgho. Gūhayati, gūhayanti iccādi.
analyzed: guha saṃvaraṇe guhitum payojeti iti ṇimhi guhissa sara iti dīghaḥ gūhayati gūhayanti iccādi
translated: Guha = concealment, in the sense of “he causes to conceal,” it is lengthened in the ṇimhi “guhissa sare” (Pāṇini 7.2.111). He conceals, they conceal, etc.

original: Disa+dusa=appītiyaṃ, dusituṃ payojetīti ṇimhi “ṇimhi dīgho dusassā”ti dīghe dūsayati+ccādi.
analyzed: disa dusa appītiyam dusitum payojeti iti ṇimhi ṇimhi dīghaḥ dusassa ati dīghe dūsayat icca ādi
translated: Disa+dusa = to displease, in the sense of “he causes to displease,” it is lengthened in the ṇimhi “ṇimhi dīgho dusassā” (Pāṇini 7.2.111). He displeases, etc.

original: Tathā icchantaṃ payojayati icchāpayati icchāpeti, esayati eseti. Niyacchantaṃ payojayati
analyzed: tathā icchantam payojayati icchāpayati icchāpeti esayati eseti niyacchantam payojayati
translated: In the same way, he causes one who desires to desire, he causes to desire, he causes to desire. He seeks, he seeks. He causes one who is restrained to be restrained,

original: niyamayati niyameti. Tathā āsayati āseti, acchāpayati acchāpeti. Lābhayati lābheti,
analyzed: niyamayati niyama iti tathā āsayati āsa iti acchāpayati acchāpa iti lābhayati lābha iti
translated: he restrains, he restrains. In the same way, he places, he places, he causes to desire, he causes to desire. He causes to obtain, he causes to obtain.

original: evaṃ vāsayati vāseti, vāsāpayati vāsāpeti. Vāhayati vāheti, vāhāpayati vāhāpeti+ccādi.
analyzed: evam vāsayati vāsā iti vāsāpayati vāsāpa iti vāhayati vāha iti vāhāpayati vāhāpa iti ca ādi
translated: In the same way, he causes to dwell, he causes to dwell, he causes to dwell, he causes to dwell. He causes to carry, he causes to carry, he causes to carry, he causes to carry, etc.

original: Evaṃ jīrayati, mārayati, dassayati iccādi. Hū=sattāyaṃ, pahontaṃ payojayati pahāvayati
analyzed: evam jīrayati mārayati dassayati iccādi hūsattāyam pahontam payojayati pahāvayati
translated: In the same way, he causes to age, he causes to die, he causes to see, etc. Hū = to be, in the sense of “he causes to abandon,” he causes to abandon,

original: pahāveti iccādi. Sāyayati sāyāpayati sāyāpeti. Nāyāpayati nāyāpeti. Patiṭṭhāpayati
analyzed: iti iccādi sāyayati sāyāpayati sāyāpeti nāyāpayati nāyāpeti patiṭṭhāpayati
translated: He causes to abandon, etc. He causes to be carried, causes to be carried away, causes to be carried off. He does not cause to be carried, does not cause to be carried away, does not cause to be carried off. He causes to be established,

original: patiṭṭhāpeti. Rasse patiṭṭhapeti. Hantuṃ payojayatīti ṇi+ṇāpī, “hanassa ghāto ṇānubandhe”ti
analyzed: patiṭṭhāpeti rasse patiṭṭhapeti hantum payojayati iti hanassa ghātaḥ
translated: he causes to be placed. He causes to be placed in a chariot. He causes to be employed for the purpose of killing. The ṇi+ṇāpī is formed by adding ṇā to the root han, which is a root of the ghāta class.

original: ghātādese ghātayati ghāteti. Tathā juhāvayati juhāveti, jahāpayati jahāpeti. Hāpayati
analyzed: ghāta ādese ghātayati ghāta iti tathā juhāvayati juhāva iti jahāpayati jahāpa iti hāpayati
translated: He causes to be killed, he causes to be slain. Likewise he causes to be offered, he causes to be offered up; he causes to be abandoned, he causes to be given up. He causes to be lost,

original: hāpeti. Dāpayati dāpeti. Vidhāpayati vidhāpeti, pidahāpayati pidahāpeti. (Bhūvādinayo).
analyzed: hāpa iti dāpayati dāpa iti vidhāpayati vidhāpa iti pidahāpayati pidahāpa iti
translated: he causes to be given. He causes to be given, he causes to be given away. He causes to be arranged, he causes to be arranged in order. He causes to be hidden,🔽he causes to be hidden away. He causes to be robbed, he causes to be robbed of. And so on.

original: Idāni rudhādiaṭṭhagaṇā dassīyante-rodhayati rodheti. Devayati deveti. Todayati todeti.
analyzed: idāni rudha ādi aṭṭhagaṇāḥ dassīyante rodhayati rodha iti devayati deva iti todayati toda iti
translated: Now the eight groups beginning with rudh are shown: He causes to weep, he causes to weep away. He causes to be given, he causes to be given away. He causes to be taken, he causes to be taken away.

original: Jayāpayati jayāpeti. Vikkayati vikkayāpeti. Sāvayati sāveti. Vitānayati vitāneti.
analyzed: jayāpayati jayāpeti vikkayati vikkayāpeti sāvayati sāveti vitānayati vitāneti
translated: He causes to be sold, he causes to be sold away. He causes to be carried, he causes to be carried away. He causes to be spread, he causes to be spread out.

original: Corāpayati corāpeti iccādi.
analyzed: corāpayati corāpa iti it cādi
translated: He causes to be robbed, he causes to be robbed of. And so on.

original: Khādīhi paccayantehi, api honti ṇi+ṇāpayo;
analyzed: kha ādīhi paccaya ntehi api honti ṇi ṇāpayaḥ
translated: With khādīhi paccayantehi, api honti ṇi+ṇāpayo;

original: Ṇi+ṇāpinā+nakānānaṃ, dassanañcettha sādhanaṃ.
analyzed: dassanam ca ittha sādhanam
translated: Ṇi+ṇāpinā+nakānānaṃ, dassanañcettha sādhanaṃ.

original: Titikkhantaṃ payojayati titikkheti titikkhāpeti, tikicchayati tikiccheti tikicchāpayati
analyzed: titikkhantam payojayati titikkha iti titikkhāpeti tikicchayati tikiccha iti tikicchāpayati
translated: He makes him endure, he endures, he causes to endure, he heals, he heals him, he causes to heal,

original: tikicchāpeti. Evaṃ bubhukkheti bubhukkhāpeti. Pabbatāyayati. Puttīyayati iccādi. (Khādipaccayanayo).🔽Iti payogasiddhiyaṃ tyādikaṇḍo chaṭṭho.🔽7. Khādikaṇḍa
analyzed: tikicchāpeti evam bubhukkheti bubhukkhāpeti pabbatāyayati puttīyayati iccādi kha ādi paccayanayo  iti chaṭṭhaḥ  kha ādi kaṇḍa
translated: He makes one endure, he causes to endure, he makes endure, he causes to endure, he cures, he causes to cure, he causes to be cured.🔽He causes to be cured. So too with the rest. (The case-ending-method).

original: Atha dhātūhiyeva bhāva+kamma+kattu+karaṇādisādhanasahitaṃ khādividhānaṃ ārabhīyate –🔽“Tijamānehi khasā khamāvīmaṃsāsu” iccādīhi paccayavidhānañca pararūpadvittādikāriyañca🔽tyādikaṇḍe vuttanayeneva ñātabbaṃ. Titikkhanaṃ titikkhā, “itthiya+maṇaktikayakayā🔽ca” iti suttena apaccayo ca “itthiya+matvā”ti āpaccayo ca hoti. Tathā vīmaṃsanaṃ🔽vīmaṃsā. “Kitā tikicchāsaṃsayesu cho”ti chappaccayādimhi kate tikicchanaṃ tikicchā,
analyzed: atha bhāva kamma kattu karaṇa ādi sādhana sahitam kha ādi vidhānam ārabhīyate 🔽tijamānehi khasā khama a vīmaṃsāsu iti ādīhi paccaya vidhānañca para rūpa dvitta ādi kāriyañca 🔽ti ādi kaṇḍe vutta nayena iva ñātabbam titikkhanam titikkhā 🔽ca iti suttena apaccayo ca itthiya matvā ati āpaccayo ca hoti tathā vīmaṃsanam 🔽vīmaṃsā kitā tikicchā saṃsayesu chaḥ ti cha ppaccaya ādimhi kate tikicchanam tikicchā
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter in the Path of Purification composed for the purpose of gladdening good people.

original: vicikicchanaṃ vicikicchā. Gupa=gopane, badha=bandhaneti imehi dhātūhi “nindāyaṃ gupa+badhā
analyzed: vicikicchanam vicikicchā gupa gopane badha bandhana iti imehi dhātūhi
translated: Doubt is vicikicchā. The roots gupa = concealing, and badha = binding, with the two

original: bassa bho ca” iti chapaccayādimhi ca dvitte parabakārassa iminā bhakāre ca kate apaccayādi
analyzed: bassa bho ca iti cha paccaya ādimhi ca dvitte para bakārassa iminā bhakāre ca kate a paccaya ādi
translated: suffixes bho and ca, and the change of the final of the first word to a,

original: hoti. Jigucchanaṃ jigucchā, bībhacchanaṃ bībhacchā. “Tuṃsmā lopo ci+cchāyaṃ te” iti
analyzed: hoti jigucchanam jiguccha bībhacchanam bībhaccha ciccha ayam te iti
translated: give apaccayādi. Disgust is jigucchā, fear is bībhacchā. “Tuṃsmā lopo ci+cchāyaṃ te”

original: icchāya+matthe kha+sa+chappaccayā honti. Bhuja=pālanajjhohāresu, bubhukkhanaṃ bubhukkhā.
analyzed: icchā ayam atthe khasa cha ppaccayāḥ honti bhuja pālana ajjhohāresu bubhukkhanam bubhukkhā
translated: gives icchāya+matthe kha+sa+chappaccayā. The root bubhukkha = hunger, gives bubhukkhā.

original: Ji=jaye, jigiṃsanaṃ, jigiṃsā. Ghasa=adane, jighacchanaṃ jighacchā.
analyzed: jijaye jigiṃsanam jigiṃsā ghasa adane jighacchanam jighacchā
translated: Ji = to conquer, gives jigiṃsanaṃ, jigiṃsā. The root ghasa = to eat, gives jighacchanaṃ, jighacchā.

original: 27. Bhāvakammesu tabbānīyā
analyzed: bhāva kammesu tabbānīyā
translated: . In the denominations of the bhāva and kamma🔽The denominations of the bhāva and kamma are formed from the roots in the sense of action,

original: Tabbaanīyā kriyatthā pare bhāvakammesu bhavanti, bahulaṃvidhānā kattukaraṇādīsupi.
analyzed: tabbaanīyā kriyatthā pare bhāva kammesu bhavanti bahulam vidhānā kattu karaṇa ādīsu pi
translated: and often in the sense of the agent, instrument, etc.

original: Bhū=sattāyaṃ, “yuvaṇṇāna+me opaccaye”ti okāre “ūbyañjanassā”ti ūāgamo, ññakāro ādyāvayavattho.
analyzed: bhū sattā ayam yuvan nā name o paccaye iti okāre ū byañjanassa ati ū āgamaḥ ñakāraḥ ādya avayava tthaḥ
translated: Bhū = to be, “yuvaṇṇāna+me opaccaye” gives okāre “ūbyañjanassā” gives ūāgamo, ññakāro ādyāvayavattho.

original: Ossa “eona+ mayavā sare”ti avādeso, bhūyateti bhavitabbaṃ bhavatā bhavanīyaṃ. Bhāvasse+kattā
analyzed: oḥ saḥ e ona ma ya vā sa rā iti a va ādesaḥ bhūyate iti bhavitabbam bhavatā bhavanīyam bhāvassa ikattā
translated: The word ossa is a form of the verb “to be” (bhū) with the prefix e and the suffix -ona. The word mayavā is a form of the verb “to be” with the prefix ma and the suffix -ya. The word sare is a form of the verb “to be” with the prefix sa and the suffix -e. The word bhūyate is a form of the verb “to be” with the prefix bhu and the suffix -yate. The word bhavitabbaṃ is a form of the verb “to be” with the prefix bhu and the suffix -vanīyaṃ. The word bhavanīyaṃ is a form of the verb “to be” with the prefix bhu and the suffix -vanīyaṃ. The word bhavatā is a form of the verb “to be” with the prefix bhu and the suffix -ta. The word bhāvasse is a form of the verb “to be” with the suffix -se.

original: ekavacanameva, tañca napuṃsakaliṅgaṃ.
analyzed: ekavacanam eva tat ca napuṃsaka liṅgam
translated: The singular number is used because of the single meaning. The neuter gender is used because of the neuter meaning.

original: Tabbādyabhihito bhāvo,
analyzed: bhāvaḥ
translated: The word tabbā is a form of the verb “to be” with the suffix -ba.

original: Dabbamiva pakāsatīti-bahuvacanañca hoti.🔽Kamme-abhipubbo, abhibhūyate abhibhūyittha abhibhūyissateti abhibhavitabbo kodho🔽paṇḍitena, abhibhavitabbā taṇhā, abhibhavitabbaṃ dukkhaṃ. Evaṃ abhibhavanīyo abhibhavanīyā🔽abhibhavanīyaṃ, kamme abhidheyyasseva liṅgavacanāni.

The word kodho is a form of the noun “anger” with the suffix -o. The word paṇḍitena is a form of the noun “wise one” with the suffix -ena. The word abhibhavitabbā is a form of the verb “to be” with

original: 95. Pararūpa+mayakāre byañjane
analyzed: para rūpam ayakāre byañjane
translated: in a substitute for a vowel,

original: Kriyatthāna+mantabyañjanassa pararūpaṃ hoti yakārato aññasmiṃ byañjane. Karīyatīti kattabbo dhammo, kattabbā pūjā, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ.
analyzed: kriyatthānam anta byañjanassa para rūpam hoti yakārataḥ aññasmim byañjane karīyati iti kattabbaḥ dhammo kattabbā pūjā kattabbam kusalam
translated: the substitute is the form of the vowel of the verb. The state that is to be done is kattabbo, worship is to be done is pūjā, what is to be done is kusalaṃ.

original: 119. Tuṃ+tuna+tabbesu vā
analyzed: tum tuna tabbesu vā
translated: In tum, tuna, and tabba, or

original: Tumādīsu karassā hoti vā. Kātabbaṃ hitaṃ.
analyzed: tuma ādīsu ka rassā hoti vā kātabbam hitam
translated: in tum and so on, karass has the form ho. What is to be done is hitaṃ.

original: 171. Rā nassa ṇo
analyzed: rāḥ nassa ṇaḥ
translated: In ra, ṇo

original: Rantato kriyatthā paccayanakārassa ṇa hoti. Karaṇīyo.
analyzed: rantataḥ paccayana kārassa ṇa hoti karaṇīyaḥ
translated: in ra, ṇo is the substitute for the vowel of the verb in the sense of “doing.” What is to be done is karaṇīyo.🔽Bhara=bearing, what is to be borne is bharitabbo, what is to be borne is bharaṇīyo.

original: Bhara=bharaṇe, bharīyatīti bharitabbo bharaṇīyo. Gaha=upādāne “maṃ vā rudhādīnaṃ”ti
analyzed: bhara bharaṇe bharīyati iti bharitabbaḥ bharaṇīyaḥ gaha upādāne mam vā
translated: Gaha=taking up, “maṃ vā rudhādīnaṃ” (Pā. 1.3.1)

original: antasarā paromaṃ vā hoti. Makāro+nubandho. “Ṇo niggahītassā”ti niggahītassa ṇo, saṃgayhatīti
analyzed: vā hoti makāraḥ anubandhaḥ no niggahītassa ati niggahītassa no saṃgayhati iti
translated: the vowel of the final syllable is lengthened or the vowel of the first syllable is lengthened. The m is a connecting vowel. “Ṇo niggahītassā” (Pā. 1.3.2)🔽the ṇ of the reduplicated syllable is elided. What is to be collected is saṃgaṇhitabbo, what is to be collected is saṃgaṇhanīyo. What is to be taken up is gahaṇīyo by tathanarā and so on.

original: saṃgaṇhitabbo saṃgaṇhanīyo, “tathanarā”dinā ṇakāre gahaṇīyo. Rama=kīḷāyaṃ, ramīyatīti
analyzed: saṃgaṇhitabbaḥ saṃgaṇhanīyaḥ tatha nara ādinā ṇakāre gahaṇīyaḥ ramakīḍā ayam ramīyati iti
translated: Rama=playing, what is to be played with is ramīyati.
