original: Pūja=pūjāyaṃ, “curādito ṇī”ti ṇimhi ñukārassa guruttā okārāvutti “yuvaṇṇāna+meo paccaye”ti ekāre pūjetabbo ūmhi ayādese pūjayitabbo pūjanīyo bhagavā.
analyzed: pūja pūjā ayam curā āditaḥ ṇi iti ṇimhi ñukārassa gu ruttā paccaye iti ekāre pūjetabbaḥ ūmhi aya ādese pūjayitabbaḥ pūjanīyaḥ bhagavā
translated: Pūja = in the sense of worship, “ṇī from curā, etc.” (Pā. 1.4.75), ṇi, the ñukāra being heavy, becomes okāra by the rule “yuvaṇṇānaṃ me paccaye” (Pā. 1.4.74), and the ñukāra is elided by the rule “the ñukāra is elided in the nominative case of the present participle” (Pā. 1.4.76), thus it is pūjetabbo, pūjanīyo bhagavā.

original: Kattari-yā=pāpuṇane, nīyatīti niyyāniyo maggo, gacchantīti gamanīyā bhogā. Karaṇe-naha=soceyye,
analyzed: kattariyā pāpuṇane nīyati iti niyyāniyaḥ maggaḥ gacchanti iti gamanīyāḥ bhogā
translated: Kattari-yā = in the sense of reaching, “nīyati” (is led) thus niyyāniyo maggo, “gacchantī” (are going) thus gamanīyā bhogā. Karaṇe-naha = in the sense of cleansing,

original: nahāyantya+nenāti nahānīyaṃ cuṇṇaṃ. Sampadāne-dā=dāne, saṃ+papubbo, sammā padīyate
analyzed: nahāyanti anena ati nahānīyam cuṇṇam sampadānedādāne saṃpapubbaḥ sammā padīyate
translated: “nahāyanti +ena” (they bathe by this) thus nahānīyaṃ cuṇṇaṃ. Sampadāne-dā = in the sense of giving, “saṃ + pappoti” (he reaches together), “sammā padīyati” (is well lit up)

original: assāti sampadāniyo brāhmaṇo.
analyzed: sampadāniyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: thus sampadāniyo brāhmaṇo.

original: 28. Ghyaṇa🔽Bhāvakammesu kriyatthā paro ghyaṇa hoti bahulaṃ. Ūmhi kattabbaṃ kāriyaṃ. Hara=haraṇe,🔽harīyatīti hāriyaṃ. Bhara=bharaṇe, bharitabbaṃ bhāriyaṃ. Labha=lābhe, “vaggalasehi🔽te”ti pubbarūpabhakāre “catutthadutiyā” dinā tatiyakkhare ca kate labhitabbaṃ labbhaṃ.🔽Vaca=byattavacane,
analyzed: ghi aṇa  bhāva kammesu kriyatthā paraḥ ghi a ṇa hoti bahulam ūmhi kattabbam kāriyam hara haraṇe  harīyati iti hāriyam bhara bharaṇe bharitabbam bhāriyam labha lābhe vagga lasehi  ta iti pubba rūpa bhakāre catuttha dutiyā dinā tatiya kkhare ca kate labhitabbam labbham  vaca byat ta vacane
translated: Ghyaṇa

original: 98. Kagā cajānaṃ ghānubandhe
analyzed: ka gā ca jānam gha anubandhe
translated: In the sense of bhāva and kamman, the past participle ending in -yaṇa is used in the sense of kriyā (action) in many cases. In the sense of what is to be done, what is to be caused to be done, what is to be made, what is to be caused to be made, what is to be done by oneself, what is to be caused to be done by another, what is to be obtained, what is to be caused to be obtained, what is to be said, what is to be caused to be said, what is to be known, what is to be caused to be known, what is to be seen, what is to be caused to be seen, what is to be heard, what is to be caused to be heard, what is to be smelt, what is to be caused to be smelt, what is to be tasted, what is to be caused to be tasted, what is to be touched, what is to be caused to be touched, what is to be thought, what is to be caused to be thought, what is to be remembered, what is to be caused to be remembered

original: Ghānubandhe cakāra+jakārantānaṃ kriyatthānaṃ ka+gā honti yathākkamaṃ.
analyzed: gha anubandhe cakāra jakāra antānam kriyat thānam ka gāḥ honti yathākkamam
translated: In the affix ghānu, the ka and ga of the verbs having the meaning of action become ka and ga respectively.

original: 84. Assā ṇānubandhe
analyzed: assāḥ ṇa anubandhe
translated: In the affix ṇānu,

original: Ṇakārānubandhe paccaye pare upantassa akārassa ā hoti. Vacanaṃ vuccateti vākyaṃ.
analyzed: ṇakāra anubandhe paccaye pare upa antassa akārassa ā hoti vacanam vuccata iti vākyam
translated: In the condition ending in the letter ṇa, the letter a of upanta becomes ā. Vacanaṃ vuccate = vākyaṃ.

original: Bhaja=sevāyaṃ, bhajanīyaṃ bhāgyaṃ, jassa gakāro. Ci=caye, cayanaṃ cīyatīti vā ceyyaṃ. Yassa dvittaṃ.
analyzed: bhajaseva ayam bhajanīyam bhāgyam jassa gakāro cicaye cayanam cīyati iti vā ceyyam yassa
translated: Bhaja = serve, bhajanīyaṃ = worthy of service, bhāgyaṃ = fortunate, jassa gakāro. Ci = heap, cayanaṃ cīyatīti vā ceyyaṃ. Yassa dvittaṃ.

original: 5,122. Nito cissa cho
analyzed: n itaḥ cissa chaḥ
translated: . Nito cissa cho

original: Nito parassa cissa cho hotītiādicakārassa cho. Vinicchayatīti viniccheyyaṃ, nāgame
analyzed: n i taḥ parassa cissa chaḥ hoti iti ādi cakārassa chaḥ vinicchayati iti viniccheyyam na āgame
translated: Nito parassa cissa cho hotītiādicakārassa cho. Vinicchayatīti viniccheyyaṃ, nāgame

original: vinicchinitabbaṃ. E+ayādesesu vinicchetabbaṃ vinicchanīyaṃ. Nī=pāpane, nīyatīti neyyo
analyzed: vinicchinitabbam e a ya ādesesu vinicchetabbam vinicchanīyam nī pāpane nīyati iti neyyaḥ
translated: vinicchinitabbaṃ. E+ayādesesu vinicchetabbaṃ vinicchanīyaṃ. Nī = to drink, nīyatīti neyyo

original: neyyā neyyaṃ, netabbaṃ.
analyzed: neyyā neyyam netabbam
translated: neyyā neyyaṃ, netabbaṃ.

original: 29. Āsse+ca
analyzed: ās seca
translated: . Āsse+ca

original: Ākārantato kriyatthā ghyaṇa hoti bhāvakammesu āssa e ca. Dā=dāne, dātabbaṃ deyyaṃ.
analyzed: ākāra antataḥ kriyatthā hoti bhāva kammesu ca dādāne dātabbam deyyam
translated: In the bhāva and kamma, ghyaṇa becomes ghyaṇa in the affix ending in a, āssa e ca. Dā = giving, dātabbaṃ deyyaṃ.

original: Pā=pāne, pīyatīti peyyaṃ. Mā=māne, mīyatīti meyyaṃ. Ñā=avabodhane, ñāyatīti ñeyyaṃ
analyzed: pā pāne pīyati iti peyyam māmāne mīyati iti meyyam ñā avabodhane ñāyati iti ñeyyam
translated: Pā = drinking, pīyatīti peyyaṃ. Mā = to honour, mīyatīti meyyaṃ. Ñā = understanding, ñāyatīti ñeyyaṃ🔽.

original: ñātabbaṃ, ūmhi nāgamo “ñāssa ne+jā”ti ñāssa jādese jānitabbaṃ, vijāniyaṃ. Khā=pakathane,
analyzed: ñātabbam ūmhi na āgamaḥ ñā assa nejāti ñā assa ja ādese jānitabbam vijāniyam kha apa kathane
translated: “Ñā” is to be known. “Ñāssa” is to be known in the sense of “ñāssa ne+jā”. “Vijāniyaṃ” is to be known. “Khā” is to be spoken.

original: saṃkhātabbaṃ saṃkheyyaṃ.
analyzed: saṃkhātabbam saṃkheyyam
translated: “Saṃkheyyaṃ” is to be counted.

original: 30. Vadādīhi yo
analyzed: vad ādīhi yaḥ
translated: . Yo with vad and so on

original: Vadādīhi kriyatthehi yo hoti bahulaṃ bhāvakammesu. Vada=vacane, vadanaṃ vajjatīti
analyzed: vad ādīhi kriyatthehi yaḥ hoti bahulam bhāva kammesu vada vacane vadanam vajjati iti
translated: “Yo” is often used in the sense of action with the verbal nouns beginning with “vad”. “Vada” is speaking. “Vajja” is blame. “Vajjati” means “it is blamed”.

original: vā vajjaṃ. Mada=ummāde, madanaṃ majjate anenāti vā majjaṃ. Gamanaṃ gammateti vā gammaṃ.
analyzed: vā vajjam mada ommāde madanam majjate anena ati vā majjam gamanam vā gammam
translated: “Mada” is intoxication. “Majja” is what one is intoxicated with. “Gamana” is going. “Gamma” is what is to be gone.

original: Gada=vacane, gajjate gadanīyaṃ vāti gajjaṃ. Pada=gamane, pajjanīyaṃ pajjaṃ gāthā.
analyzed: gada vacane gajjate gadanīyam vāti gajjam pada gamane pajjanīyam pajjam gāthā
translated: “Gada” is speaking. “Gajja” is what is to be spoken. “Pada” is going. “Pajja” is what is to be gone. “Gāthā” is a verse.

original: Ada+khāda=bhakkhane, khajjatīti khajjaṃ khādanīyaṃ. Dama=damane, dammateti dammo damanīyo.
analyzed: ada khāda bhakkhane khajjati iti khajjam khādanīyam dama damane dammatā iti dammaḥ damanīyaḥ
translated: “Ada+khāda” is eating. “Khajjana” is what is to be eaten. “Dama” is taming. “Dammo” is what is to be tamed.

original: Bhujā+nneti gaṇasuttena anne vattabbe yapaccayo.
analyzed: bhuja anne iti gaṇa suttena anne vattabbe ya paccayaḥ
translated: “Bhujā+nneti” is the rule for the affix “ya” when “anne” is to be stated.

original: 83. Lahussupantassati
analyzed: lahuḥ supantaḥ sati
translated: . Lahubhūta, upanta, iyu

original: Lahubhūtassa upantassa iyuvaṇṇassa eo honti yathākkamaṃ. Yassa pubbarūpe bhuñjitabboti bhojjo odano, bhojjā yāgu.🔽31. Kicca ghacca bhacca bhabba leyyā
analyzed: lahu bhūtassa upantassa iyuvaṇṇassa honti yathākkamam yassa pubbarūpe bhuñjitabbaḥ uti bhojjaḥ odanaḥ bhojjā yāgu 🔽kicca ghacca bhacca bhabba leyyā
translated: “Eo” are used for “lahubhūta”, “upanta” and “iyu” respectively. “Bhuñjitabbo” is “bhojjo” rice. “Bhojjā” is gruel.

original: Ete saddā yapaccayantā nipaccante. Kara=karaṇe, iminā nipātanā ye kicādese ca kate🔽pubbarūpaṃ, kattabbaṃ kiccaṃ. Hana=hiṃsāyaṃ, ghaccādesādimhi kate hananaṃ haññateti
analyzed: ete saddāḥ nipaccante kara karaṇe nipātanā ye ki ca ādese ca kate  pubbarūpam kattabbam kiccam hana hiṃsā ayam gha c ca ādesa ādimhi kate hananam hañña tā iti
translated: These are the words that are formed by adding the suffixes. Kara=karaṇe, when this is done, the suffix is added, and the k is changed to c.🔽The k is the original form. Kiccaṃ is what is to be done. Hana=hiṃsāyaṃ, when ghaccādesādimhi is done, the suffix is added, and the h is changed to g.

original: vā ghaccaṃ. Bhara=bharaṇe, bhaccādesādimhi kate bharaṇīyo bhacco. Bhū=sattāyaṃ, yamhi
analyzed: vā ghaccam bhara bharaṇe bhacca ādesa ādimhi kate bharaṇīyaḥ bhaccaḥ yamhi
translated: The g is the striking. Bhara=bharaṇe, when bhaccādesādimhi is done, the suffix is added, and the r is changed to c.🔽The c is what is to be borne. Bhū=sattāyaṃ, when yamhi is done, the suffix is added, and the u is changed to o.

original: okāre iminā avādese bhavatīti bhabbo. Liha=assādane, yamhi iminā hassa yakāre lehitabbaṃ
analyzed: okāre iminā a vādese bhavati iti bhabbaḥ yamhi iminā hassa yakāre lehitabbam
translated: The o is what is possible. Liha=assādane, when yamhi is done, the suffix is added, and the h is changed to y.

original: leyyaṃ, ekāravuddhi.
analyzed: leyyam
translated: The y is what is to be licked.

original: 32. Guhādīhi yaka
analyzed: guhā ādīhi yaka
translated: . Guhādīhi yaka

original: Guhādīhi kriyatthehi bhāvakammesu yaka hoti. Guha=saṃvaraṇe, “lahussupantassā”ti
analyzed: guha ādīhi bhāva kammesu yaka hoti guha saṃvaraṇe
translated: With guh and other verbs meaning “to do”, yaka is used for the state and the action. Guha=saṃvaraṇe, “of one who is sleeping lightly”

original: sampattassa okārassa “na te kānubandhanāgamesū”ti paṭisedho. “Hassa vipallāso”ti
analyzed: sampattassa okārassa na te kā anubandhanā āgamesu ti paṭisedhaḥ hassa vipallāso ti
translated: the o that has been obtained is prohibited by “na te kānubandhanāgamesu”. “Hassa vipallāso”

original: vipallāse guhanaṃ guhitabbaṃ guyhaṃ. Duha=papūraṇe, dohanaṃ duyhatīti vā duyhaṃ. Sāsa=anusiṭṭhiyaṃ –
analyzed: vipallāse guhanam guhitabbam guyham duha papūraṇe dohanam duyhati iti vā duyham sāsa anusiṭṭhiyam
translated: in the vipallāsa, the guhana is what is to be concealed, the guyha. Duha=papūraṇe, dohanaṃ duyhatīti vā duyha. Sāsa=anusiṭṭhiyaṃ –

original: 117. Sāsassa sisa vā
analyzed: sāsassa sisa vā
translated: . Sāsassa sisa vā

original: Sāsassa sisa vā hoti kānubandhe. Pubbarūpaṃ, sāsīyatīti sisso.
analyzed: vā hoti ka anubandhe pubbarūpam
translated: and the head is the beginning of the body. The head is the beginning because it is the first to be produced, and because it is the chief, and because it is the most useful part, and because it is the most prominent.

original: Siddhā eve+te tabbādayo pesā+tisagga+ppattakālesu gamyamānesupi, sāmaññena vidhānato.
analyzed: siddhāḥ eva ete tabba ādayaḥ sāmaññena vidhānato
translated: These words “should be done” and so on are established even when the times of sending, urging, and opportunity are being referred to, because of the general rule.

original: Pesanaṃ – “kattabba+midaṃ bhavatā”ti āṇāpanaṃ ajjhesanañca. Atisaggo nāma “ki+midaṃ🔽mayā kattabbaṃ”ti puṭṭhassa “pāṇo na hantabbo”tiādinā paṭipattidassanamukhena kattabbassa
analyzed: pesanam kattabbam idam bhavatā ati āṇāpanam ajjhesanam ca atisaggo nāma kim idam  mayā kattabbaṃti puṭṭhassa pāṇaḥ na hantabbaḥ iti ādinā paṭipatti dassana mukhena kattabbassa
translated: Sending is the act of ordering and urging someone to do something by saying “This should be done by you.” Urging is the act of asking someone by saying “What should be done by me?”

original: anuññā. Pattakālo nāma sampattasamayo. Yo kiccakaraṇasamayaṃ upaparikkhitvā karoti,
analyzed: anuññā patta kālaḥ nāma sampatta samayaḥ yaḥ kicca karaṇa samayam upaparikkhitvā karoti
translated: Opportunity is the time that has arrived. When someone does something after examining the time for doing it,

original: tassa samayārocanaṃ, na tattha ajjhesana+matthi. Bhotā khalu kaṭo kattabbo karaṇīyo
analyzed: tassa samaya ārocanam na tattha ajjhesanam atthi bhotā khalu kaṭaḥ kattabbaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: the announcement of the time is made to him, but there is no urging there. “The bowl should be made by you, venerable sir. The bowl should be made by you, venerable sir. The bowl should be made by you, venerable sir.”

original: kāriyo kicco” evaṃ tvayā kaṭo kattabbo, bhoto hi patto kālo kaṭakaraṇe.
analyzed: kāriyaḥ kiccaḥ evam tvayā kaṭaḥ kattabbaḥ bhotaḥ hi patto kālaḥ kaṭa karaṇe
translated: In this way, “The bowl should be made by you, venerable sir. The time for making the bowl has arrived for you, venerable sir.”🔽In the same way, even when sending and so on are being used in the sense of “is being done” and so on, they are established.

original: Evaṃ uddhamuhuttepi vattamānato pesādīsu siddhā eva. Tathā arahe kattari sattivisiṭṭhe
analyzed: evam uddha muhutte pi vattamānato pesa ādīsu siddhā eva tathā arahe kattari satti visiṭṭhe
translated: In the same way, “should be done” is established in the sense of “is being done” and so on.

original: ca patīyamāne, āvassakā+dhamīṇatāvisiṭṭhe ca bhāvādo siddhā. Uddhaṃ muhuttato-bhotā🔽kaṭo kattabbo. Bhotā rajjaṃ kātabbaṃ, bhavaṃ araho. Bhotā bhāro vahitabbo, bhavaṃ
analyzed: ca patīyamāne ca bhāva ādaḥ siddhā  kaṭaḥ kattabbaḥ bhotā rajjam kātabbam bhavam arahaḥ bhotā bhāraḥ vahitabbaḥ bhavam
translated: and in the future, in the past, and in the present, the distinction of the state of being is established by the affix -tā.🔽In the future, the work is to be done. The kingdom is to be ruled. He is to be honoured. The burden is to be borne by him. He is

original: sakko. Bhotā avassaṃ kaṭo kattabbo. Bhotā nikkho dātabbo.
analyzed: sakkaḥ bhotā avassam kaṭaḥ kattabbaḥ bhotā nikkhaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: able. In the future, the work is to be done by him. The gift is to be given by him.

original: ūssa ekāre gaṇhātīti gahetā. Bhavatīti bhavitā. Saratīti saritā. “Manānaṃ niggahītaṃ”ti🔽massa niggahīte vaggante ca gacchatīti gantā. Nakārantānampi niggahītaṃ, khanatīti
analyzed: ekāre gaṇhāti iti bhavati iti bhavitā sarati iti saritā  massa niggahīte vagga ante ca gacchati iti gantā nakāra antānam pi niggahītam khanati iti
translated: He takes up the vowel ū, thus he is a gahetā. He becomes, thus he is a bhavitā. He remembers, thus he is a saritā. “The conceiving is checked”

original: khantā. Sanatīti santā. Maññatīti mantā. Pāletīti pālayitā pāletā, ettha curādittā ṇi.🔽Ṇiṇāpīsu-bhāvayatīti bhāvayitā bhāvetā. Evaṃ sārayitā sāretā, dāpayitā dāpetā, hāpayitā
analyzed: khantā sanati iti santā maññati iti mantā pāleti iti pālayitā pāletā ettha curā t ittā ṇi  evam sārayitā sāretā dāpayitā dāpetā hāpayitā
translated: He goes to the checked and the unchecked, thus he is a gantā. The checked of the nakāras is also: He digs, thus he is a khantā. He is, thus he is a santā. He conceives, thus he is a mantā. He protects, thus he is a pālayitā, a pāletā. Here the ṇ is from the root curā.

original: hāpetā, nirodhayitā nirodhetā, bodhayitā bodhetā, ñāpayitā ñāpetā, sāvayitā sāvetā,
analyzed: hāpetā nirodhayitā nirodhetā bodhayitā bodhetā ñāpayitā ñāpetā sāvayitā sāvetā
translated: He causes to grow, thus he is a bhāvayitā, a bhāvetā. So too he is a sārayitā, a sāretā; he is a dāpayitā, a dāpetā; he is a hāpayitā, a hāpetā; he is a nirodhayitā, a nirodhetā; he is a bodhayitā, a bodhetā; he is a ñāpayitā, a ñāpetā; he is a sāvayitā, a sāvetā;

original: gāhayitā gāhetā, kārayitā kāretā, kārāpayitā kārāpetā iccādi.
analyzed: gāhayitā gāhetā kārayitā kāretā kārāpayitā kārāpetā iccādi
translated: he is a gāhayitā, a gāhetā; he is a kārayitā, a kāretā; he is a kārāpayitā, a kārāpetā, and so on.

original: Ṇkapaccaye-ṇakāro vuddhyattho. Rathaṃ karotīti rathakārako, “assā ṇānubandhe”ti ā
analyzed: ṇ ka paccaya iṇakāraḥ vuddhi atthaḥ ratham karoti iti rathakārakaḥ assā ṇa anubandhā iti ā
translated: In the case of the ṇkapaccayas, the ṇ is in the sense of “increase.” He makes a chariot, thus he is a rathakārako. “The ṇ follows the a”🔽and so on. The compound is of the anna-type. He gives food, thus he is an annadāyako. “The ṇ is ghe+ssī after a root ending in a vowel”

original: amādisamāso ca. Annaṃ dadātīti annadāyako. “Adhātussa kā+syādito ghe+ssī”ti ghe pare
analyzed: am ādi samāsaḥ ca annam dadāti iti anna dāyakaḥ a dhātussa kā asya āditaḥ ghessi iti ghe pare
translated: and so on.

original: assa iādeso, annadāyikā, annadāyakaṃ kulaṃ. “Āssā+ṇāpimhi yuka” itiṇāpito+ññatra
analyzed: assaḥ i ādesaḥ anna dāyikā anna dāyakam kulam āssa a ṇāpimhi yukaḥ iti ṇāpi taḥ uññatra
translated: “Assa” is a horse; “iādeso” is a place for horses; “antadāyikā” is a giver of food; “antadāyakaṃ kulaṃ” is a family that gives food. “Āssā+ṇāpimhi yuka” means “yoked to a carriage”. “Iṇāpito+ññatra yuka” means “yoked to a plough”.

original: yuka. Lokaṃ netīti lokanāyako, ekāre “āyā+vā ṇānubandhe”ti āyādeso. Evaṃ vinetīti vināyako.
analyzed: lokam na iti iti lokanāyakaḥ ekāre evam vinā iti iti vināyakaḥ
translated: “Lokaṃ netīti lokanāyako” means “the leader of the world”. “Ekāre āyā+vā ṇānubandhe” means “āyādeso”. “Evaṃ vinetīti vināyako” means “the trainer”.

original: Akammupapade-karotīti kārako, evaṃ dāyako nāyako, okāre āvādese suṇātīti sāvako.
analyzed: evam dāyakaḥ nāyakaḥ okāre āvādese suṇāti iti sāvakaḥ
translated: “Akammupapade-karotīti kārako” means “the maker”. “Evaṃ dāyako nāyako” means “the giver” and “the leader”. “Okāre āvādese suṇātīti sāvako” means “the hearer”.

original: Pure viya ikāre sāvikā. Lunātīti lāvako. Pu=pavane, punātīti pāvako. Bhavatīti bhāvako,
analyzed: pure ikāre sāvikā lunāti iti pupavane punāti iti pāvakaḥ bhavati iti
translated: “Pure viya ikāre sāvikā” means “the female hearer”. “Lunātīti lāvako” means “the washer”. “Pu=pavane, punātīti pāvako” means “the purifier”. “Bhavatīti bhāvako” means “the one who becomes”.

original: upāsatīti upāsako. Gaṇhātīti gāhako pāvako, yājako. Vadha=hiṃsāyaṃ, vadhetīti vadhako,
analyzed: upāsati iti upāsakaḥ gaṇhāti iti gāhakaḥ pāvakaḥ yājakaḥ vadha hiṃsā ayam vadha iti iti vadhakaḥ
translated: “Upāsatīti upāsako” means “the one who worships”. “Gaṇhātīti gāhako pāvako, yājako” means “the one who takes” and “the one who sacrifices”. “Vadha=hiṃsāyaṃ, vadhetīti vadhako” means “the killer”.

original: “aññatrāpī”ti vuddhipaṭisedho. “Hanassa ghāto ṇānubandhe”ti ghātādeso, hanatīti ghātako.
analyzed: aññatra api iti vuddhi paṭisedhaḥ hanassa ghātaḥ ghāta ādesaḥ hanati iti ghātako
translated: “Aññatrāpī” means “no augment”. “Hanassa ghāto ṇānubandhe” means “ghātādeso”. “Hanatīti ghātako” means “the killer”.

original: “Maṃ vā rudhādīnaṃ”ti maṃ, rundhako, guruttā na vuddhi. Tathā bhuñjatīti bhuñjako.
analyzed: vā mam rundhakaḥ tathā bhuñjati iti bhuñjakaḥ
translated: “Maṃ vā rudhādīnaṃ” means “maṃ”. “Rundhako, guruttā na vuddhi” means “the one who obstructs”. “Tathā bhuñjatīti bhuñjako” means “the eater”.

original: Āyassa rasse kiṇātīti kayako. Pāletīti pālako. Pūjetīti pūjako.
analyzed: āyassa rasse kiṇāti iti kayakaḥ pāleti iti pālako pūjeti iti pūjako
translated: “Āyassa rasse kiṇātīti kayako” means “the buyer”. “Pāletīti pālako” means “the protector”. “Pūjetīti pūjako”

original: Khādīsu-titikkhatīti titikkhako. Vīmaṃsatīti vīmaṃsako iccādi. Panudatīti panūdako,
analyzed: kha ādīsu titikkhati iti titikkhakaḥ vīmaṃsati iti vīmaṃsakaḥ iccādi panudati iti panūdako
translated: In the case of the words khādīsu-titikkhati, the word titikkhako is formed by the addition of the kka suffix. In the case of the words vīmaṃsati, the word vīmaṃsako is formed by the addition of the kka suffix. In the case of the words panudati, the word panūdako is formed by the addition of the kka suffix.

original: “byañjane”ccādinā dīgho. “Bhītvā+nako”ti ettha ‘ānako’ti yogavibhāgā ānako, āssa
analyzed: byañjana icca ādinā dīghaḥ ettha ānakaḥ iti yogavibhāgā ānakaḥ āssa
translated: The word dīgho is formed by the addition of the suffix -gha to the word dīgha. In the case of the word bhītvānako, the word ānako is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word āna. The word āna is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ā.

original: rasse nakārāgame ca “ñāssa ne jā”ti jādeso, jānanako. Ṇāpimhi –🔽Aṇa-iti daṇḍakadhātu, āṇāpetīti āṇāpako. Tathā saññāpako, patiṭṭhāpako. Saṃ+pa pubbo āpa=pāpuṇane, nibbānaṃ sampāpetīti nibbānasampāpako. Kārāpako, kārāpikā iccādi.
analyzed: rasse nakāra āgame ca ñā assa ne jāti jā desaḥ jānanakaḥ ṇa apimhi  aṇaiti daṇḍaka dhātu āṇāpeti iti āṇāpako tathā saññāpako patiṭṭhāpako sampa āpa pāpuṇane nibbānam sampāpeti iti nibbāna sampāpako kārāpako kārāpikā iccādi
translated: The word jānanako is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word jāna. The word jāna is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word jñā.

original: Bahulaṃvidhānā kammepi-pādehi harīyatīti pādahārako. Cupa=mandagamane, gale cuppatīti galacopako.🔽Siddhova ltu arahādīsu “bhavaṃ khalu kaññāya pariggahāraho”ti (pariggahitā). Sīlatthe-upādānasīloti🔽upādātā. Sādhu gacchatīti gantā. Muṇḍanadhammā muṇḍanācārāti muṇḍayitāro, ettha “dhātvatthe
analyzed: bahulam vidhānā cupa manda gamane gale cuppati iti gala copako 🔽siddhaḥ u vā l tu araha ādīsu bhavam khalu kaññāya pariggaha arahā iti pariggahitā 🔽upādātā sādhu gacchati iti gantā muṇḍana dhammā muṇḍana ācārā ati muṇḍayitāraḥ ettha dhātu atthe
translated: The word āṇāpako is formed by the addition of the suffix -pa to the word āṇā. The word āṇā is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ā. The word ā is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word ān is formed by the addition of the suffix -na to the word ān. The word

original: nāmasmī”ti imhi ūāgame e+ayādese muṇḍayitusaddamhi āraṅādese ca kate yossa ṭo.
analyzed: nām asmi iti imhi ū āgame e a y ādese muṇḍayitu saddamhi āraṅ ādese ca kate yossa ṭaḥ
translated: In the passage, “I am a monk,” the word “monk” is a noun, and the word “shaven” is an adjective.

original: 34. Āvī
analyzed: āvī
translated: 34. The Unconsecrated

original: Kriyatthā āvī hoti bahulaṃ kattari. “Disassa passa+dassa=dasa+da+dakkhā”ti dassādeso,
analyzed: kriyatthāḥ āvī hoti bahulam kattari disassa dassa ādesaḥ
translated: Āvī is a suffix expressing the meaning of action and is generally added to the agent. “Disassa passa+dassa=dasa+da+dakkhā” means “one who sees the direction.”

original: bhayaṃ passatīti bhayadassāvī. Nīmhi bhayadassāvinī. Bhayadassāvi cittaṃ. Appavisayatāñāpanatthaṃ
analyzed: bhayam passati iti bhaya dassāvī cittam appa visaya tā ñāpana tham
translated: One who sees fear is called bhayadassāvī. In the feminine, bhayadassāvinī. Bhayadassāvi cittaṃ. The word is split to show that it has a limited meaning.

original: bhinnayogakaraṇaṃ. Sāmaññavihitattā sīlādīsu ca hoteva.
analyzed: bhinna yoga karaṇam sāmañña vihita ttā sīla ādīsu ca hotā iva
translated: It is also used for morality, etc., because they are prescribed by the Buddha.

original: 35. Āsiṃsāya+mako
analyzed: āsiṃsāyamakaḥ
translated: ĀSIṂSĀYA+MAKO

original: Āsiṃsāyaṃ gammamānāyaṃ kriyatthā ako hoti kattari. Jīva=pāṇadhāraṇe, jīvatūti jīvako. Nanda=samiddhiyaṃ, nandatūti nandako. Bhavatūti bhavako.
analyzed: āsiṃsa ayam gammamānāyam kriyatthāḥ akaḥ hoti kattari jīva pāṇa dhāraṇe jīvatu iti jīvakaḥ nanda samiddhiyam nandatu iti nandakaḥ bhavatu iti bhavakaḥ
translated: Āko is a suffix expressing the meaning of action and is added to the agent when the action is being done with an instrument. Jīva=pāṇadhāraṇe, jīvatūti jīvako. Nanda=samiddhiyaṃ, nandatūti nandako. Bhavatūti bhavako.

original: 36. Karā ṇano
analyzed: karā ṇano
translated: KARĀ ṆANO

original: Karato kattari ṇa no hoti. Karotīti kāraṇaṃ. Kattarīti kiṃ, karoti anenāti karaṇaṃ.🔽37. Hāto vīhi+kālesu
analyzed: karato kattari na no hoti karoti iti kāraṇam kattari iti kim karoti anena ati karaṇam 🔽hā taḥ vīhi kālesu
translated: Ṇo is added to kara to express the agent. Karotīti kāraṇaṃ. Kattarīti kiṃ, karoti anenāti karaṇaṃ.

original: Hāto vīhismiṃ kāle ca ṇano hoti. “Āssā”tyādinā yuka, jahanti udakaṃti hāyanā vīhayo. Jahāti bhāve padattheti hāyano saṃvaccharo. Vīhikālesūti kiṃ, jahātīti hātā.
analyzed: hātaḥ vīhismin kāle ca hoti āssā atyādinā yuka jahanti udakam iti hāyanāḥ vīhayaḥ jahāti bhāve hāyano saṃvaccharaḥ vīhi kālesu iti kim jahāti iti hātā
translated: In the word vīhaṃ, the vowel of hā is lengthened in the sense of time. The word vīhaṃ is derived from the root jah + ā + ssā + na. The rain-clouds are called vīhaṃ because they let fall the rain. The word saṃvaccharo is derived from the root jah + bhāva + padattha + na. The word vīhaṃ is derived from the root jah + kāla + na.

original: 38. Vidā kū
analyzed: vidā kū
translated: . Vidā kū

original: Vidasmā kū hoti kattari. Kakāro “kūto”ti visesanattho. Vidatīti vidū, lokavidū.
analyzed: vidasma hoti kattari kakāraḥ visesana tthaḥ vidati iti vidū loka vidū
translated: The word kū is added to the root vid in the sense of an agent. The letter ka is added in order to distinguish the word from the word kū, which means “pit.” The word vidū is derived from the root vid + u. The word lokavidū is derived from the root vid + u + loka + u.

original: 39. Vito ñāto
analyzed: v itaḥ ña ā taḥ
translated: . Vito ñāto

original: Vipubbā ñāicca+smā kū hoti kattari. Vijānātīti viññū.
analyzed: vi pubbā ñā it casmā kū hoti kattari vijānāti iti viññū
translated: The word kū is added to the root vi + pu + ñā in the sense of an agent. The word viññū is derived from the root vi + ñā + u.

original: 40. Kammā
analyzed: kammā
translated: . Kammā

original: Kammato parā ñāicca+smā kū hoti kattari. Sabbaṃ jānātīti sabbaññū. Evaṃ mattaññū, dhammaññū, atthaññū kālaññū, kataññū iccādi. (Bhikkhūti pana “bharādi” ṇvādisuttena siddhaṃ).
analyzed: kammataḥ parā ñā i ccasmā kū hoti kattari sabbam jānāti iti sabbaññū evam mattaññū dhammaññū atthaññū kālaññū kataññū iccādi bhikkhu iti pana bhara ādi ṇu ādi suttena siddham
translated: The word kū is added to the root kam + parā + ñā in the sense of an agent. The word sabbaññū is derived from the root kam + ñā + u. The words mattaññū, dhammaññū, atthaññū, kālaññū, and kataññū are derived in the same way. The word bhikkhu is derived from the root bhar + ādi + ṇvādi.

original: 41. Kvacaṇa🔽Kammato parā kriyatthā kvaci aṇa hoti kattari. Kumbhaṃ karotīti kumbhakāro, amādisamāso.
analyzed: kva caṇa  parā kriyatthā kvaci hoti kattari kumbham karoti iti kumbhakāraḥ ama ādi samāsaḥ
translated: . Kvacaṇa

original: Itthiyaṃ kumbhakārī. Evaṃ kammakāro, māsākāro, kaṭṭhakāro, rathakāro suvaṇṇakāro,
analyzed: itthiyam kumbhakārī evam kammakāraḥ māsākāro kaṭṭhakāraḥ rathakāro suvaṇṇakāro
translated: The word aṇa is added to the root kam + parā + kriyā in the sense of an agent. The word kumbhakāra is derived from the root kam + aṇa. The word kumbhakārī is derived from the root kam + parā + kriyā + i. The words kammakāra, māsākāra, kaṭṭhakāra, rathakāra, and suvaṇṇakāra are derived in the same way.

original: suttakāro, vuttikāro, ṭīkākāro. Saraṃ lunātīti saralāvoti o+avādesā. Mante ajjhāyatīti🔽manthajjhāyo, i=ajjhenagatīsu, adhipubbo, e+ayādesā, adhino issa yakāra+cavaggādayo ca.🔽Bahulādhikārā iha na hoti “ādiccaṃ passati, himavantaṃ suṇoti, gāmaṃ gacchati”. Kvacīti kiṃ, kammakaro, ettha apaccayo.🔽42. Gamā rū🔽Kammato parā gamā rū hoti kattari. Rānubandhattā amabhāgalopo. Vedaṃ gacchatīti vedagū, evaṃ pāragū.🔽Sāmaññavidhānato sīlādīsupi hoti. Bhavapāraṃ gacchati sīlenāti bhavapāragū. Antagamanasīlo antagū, evaṃ addhagū.🔽43. Samāna+ñña+bhavanta+yāditū+pamānā disā kamme rī+rikkha+kā
analyzed: sutta kāraḥ vutti kāraḥ ṭīkā kāraḥ saram lunāti iti o a va ādesā mante ajjhāyati iti  mantha jhāyaḥ i a jhe na gatīsu adhi pubbaḥ e a yādesāḥ adhinaḥ issa yakāra ca vagga ādayaḥ ca  bahula adhikārā iha na hoti ādiccam passati himavantam suṇoti gāmam gacchati kvaci iti kim kamma karaḥ ettha apaccayo  gamā rū  parā gamā rū hoti kattari ra anubandha ttā ama bhāga lopaḥ vedam gacchati iti vedagū evam pāragū  sāmañña vidhānato sīla ādīsu pi hoti bhava pāram gacchati sīlena ati bhava pāragū anta gamana sīlaḥ antagū evam addhagū  samān añña bhavanta yādi tu upamānāḥ disā kamme rīrikkhakā
translated: The composer of a sutta, the composer of a commentary, the composer of a sub-commentary. He pours out the essence, thus he is an “essence-pourer” . He meditates on the rules, thus he is a “meditator on the rules” .

original: samāse “rānubandhe+ntasarādissā”ti disassa isabhāgalope “rīrikkhakesū”ti samānassa
analyzed: samāse ra anubandha inta sara ādissa ati disassa isa bhāga lope rīrikkhakesu iti samānassa
translated: In the compound, “in the direction, etc., of the equal,” the direction has the state of the is-part elided, and “in the equal, etc., of the equal” is the same as

original: sādese ca samāno viya dissatīti sadī, sadikkho. Ke – “na te kānubandhanāgamesū”ti ettābhāvo, sadiso.
analyzed: sa ādese ca samānaḥ viya dissati iti ke na te ka anubandhana āgamesu iti ettābhāvaḥ sadisaḥ
translated: the equal. And it appears as if equal, therefore it is equal, equal in direction. Ke – “not in the equal, etc., of the equal” – this is the state of non-existence, equal.

original: 125. Samānā ro rī+rikkha+kesu
analyzed: samānāḥ raḥ rīrikkhakesu
translated: . Equal, etc., in the equal, etc.

original: Samānasaddato parassa disassa ra hoti vā rī+rikkha+kesūti pakkhe dassa rādese sarī, sarikkho, sariso.
analyzed: samāna saddataḥ parassa disassa ra hoti vā rīrikkhakesu iti pakkhe dassa ra ādese sarī sarikkhaḥ sarisaḥ
translated: After a word of equality, ra is optionally substituted for the direction, in the case of the equal, etc. In the case of the equal, etc., of the equal, there is sarī, sarikkho, sariso.

original: 3,86. Sabbādīna+mā
analyzed: sap ba ādīn amā
translated: . Of all, etc.

original: Rī+rikkha+kesu sabbādīna+mā hoti. Añño viya dissatīti aññādī, aññādikkho, aññādiso.
analyzed: rīrikkhakesu sabba ādīnamā hoti aññaḥ viya dissati iti añña ādī añña ādikkhaḥ añña ādiso
translated: Of all, etc., is substituted for the equal, etc. It appears as if different, therefore it is different, etc., different in direction, different, etc.

original: 3,87. Nta+ki+mi+mānaṃ ṭā+kī+ṭī
analyzed: nta kim imānam ṭākīṭī
translated: . The nta, kiṃ, and ma, and the ṭā, kī, and ṭī

original: Rī+rikkha+kesu nta+kiṃ+imasaddānaṃ ṭā+kī+ṭī honti yathākkamaṃ. Ṭakārā sabbādesatthā.
analyzed: rīrikkhakesu nta kiṃima saddānam ṭā kīṭī honti yathākkamam ṭakārā sabba ādesa atthā
translated: The nta, kiṃ, and ma are substituted for the ṭā, kī, and ṭī respectively, in the equal, etc. The ṭā is the meaning of all substitution.

original: Bhavādī bhavādikkho bhavādiso, kīdī kīdikkho kīdiso, ayamiva dissatīti īdī īdikkho
analyzed: bhavādī bhavādikkhaḥ bhavādisaḥ kīdī kīdikkhaḥ kīdisaḥ ayam iva dissati iti īdī īdikkhaḥ
translated: Of being, etc., of being, etc., in direction, of being, etc., kīdī, kīdikkho, kīdiso. It appears as if this, therefore it is īdī, īdikkho,

original: īdiso. Ākāre yādī yādikkho yādiso, tyādī tyādikkho tyādiso iccādi.
analyzed: īdisaḥ ākāre yādī yādikkhaḥ yādisaḥ tyādī tyādikkhaḥ tyādisaḥ iccādi
translated: īdiso. In the case of the ā, yādī, yādikkho, yādiso. In the case of the ty, tyādī, tyādikkho, tyādiso, and so on.

original: 3,88. Tumhāmhānaṃ tāme+kasmiṃ
analyzed: tumha amhānam tām ekasmin
translated: Tumhāmhānaṃ tāme+kasmiṃ

original: Rī+rikkha+kesu tumhāmhānaṃ tāmā honte+kasmiṃ yathākkamaṃ. Tvaṃ viya dissati, ayaṃ viya dissatīti tādī mādī iccādi. Ekasminti kiṃ, tumhādiso amhādiso.
analyzed: rīrikkhakesu tumha amhānam tāmāḥ honti ekasmin yathākkamam tvam viya dissati ayam viya dissati iti tādī mādī iccādi ekasmin ti kim tumhādisaḥ amhādisaḥ
translated: Rī+rikkha+kesu tumhāmhānaṃ tāmā honte+kasmiṃ yathākkamaṃ. Tvaṃ viya dissati, ayaṃ viya dissatīti tādī mādī iccādi. Ekasminti kiṃ, tumhādiso amhādiso.

original: 3,89. Taṃ+ma+maññatra
analyzed: taṃ mama aññatra
translated: Taṃ+ma+maññatra

original: Rīrikkhakantato+ññasmiṃ uttarapade tumhāmhāna+mekasmiṃ taṃ+maṃ honti yathākkamaṃ.
analyzed: uttara pade tumha amhānam ekasmin taṃ mam honti yathākkamam
translated: Rīrikkhakantato+ññasmiṃ uttarapade tumhāmhāna+mekasmiṃ taṃ+maṃ honti yathākkamaṃ.

original: Tvaṃ dīpo esaṃ, ahaṃ dīpo esaṃti aññapadatthe taṃdīpā maṃdīpā. Tvaṃ saraṇa+mesaṃ,
analyzed: tvam dīpaḥ esam aham dīpaḥ esam ti añña padatthe taṃdīpā maṃdīpā tvam saraṇam esam
translated: Tvaṃ dīpo esaṃ, ahaṃ dīpo esaṃti aññapadatthe taṃdīpā maṃdīpā. Tvaṃ saraṇa+mesaṃ,

original: ahaṃ saraṇa+ mesanti taṃsaraṇā maṃsaraṇā. Tayā yogo tayyogo, mayā yogo mayyogoti
analyzed: aham tayyogo tayyogo mayyogo uti
translated: ahaṃ saraṇa+ mesanti taṃsaraṇā maṃsaraṇā. Tayā yogo tayyogo, mayā yogo mayyogoti

original: amādisamāse niggahītalopo.
analyzed: am ādi samāse niggahīta lopaḥ
translated: amādisamāse niggahītalopo.

original: 3,90. Ve+tasse+ṭa
analyzed: vā itas seṭa
translated: Ve+tasse+ṭa

original: Rī+rikkha+kesu etassa eṭa vā hoti. Edī etādī, edikkho etādikkho, ediso etādiso.
analyzed: rīrikkhakesu etassa vā hoti edī etādī edikkhaḥ etādikkhaḥ edisaḥ etādisaḥ
translated: Rī+rikkha+kesu etassa eṭa vā hoti. Edī etādī, edikkho etādikkho, ediso etādiso.

original: 44. Bhāvakārake sva+ghaṇa gha kā
analyzed: bhāva kārake sva gha ṇa gha kā
translated: Bhāvakārake sva+ghaṇa gha kā

original: Bhāve kārake ca kriyatthā a ghaṇa gha kā honti bahulaṃ.
analyzed: bhāve kārake ca kriyatthāḥ a ghaṇa gha kā honti bahulam
translated: Bhāve kārake ca kriyatthā a ghaṇa gha kā honti bahulaṃ.

original: Apaccayo-paggaṇhanaṃ paggaho, evaṃ niggaho, dhammaṃ dhāretīti dhammadharo, evaṃ vinayadharo.
analyzed: a paccaya upaggaṇhanam paggahaḥ evam niggahaḥ dhammam dhāreti iti dhamma dharaḥ evam vinaya dharaḥ
translated: The taking of what is not a condition is a condition. So too, the taking of what is a condition is a condition. The taking of what is not a restraint is a restraint. So too, the taking of what is a restraint is a restraint. He bears the True Idea, thus he is an idea-bearer. So too, he is a discipline-bearer.🔽He does it thus, thus he is a doer. So too, he is a benefactor. He is a day-maker. He is a day-maker. He is a day-maker.

original: Tathā taṃ karotīti takkaro, dvittaṃ. Evaṃ hitakaro, divasakaro, dinakaro, divākaro,
analyzed: tathā tam karoti iti takkaraḥ evam hita karaḥ divasa karaḥ dina karaḥ divākaraḥ
translated: He is a night-maker. He takes a bow, thus he is a bowman. So too, he is a coat-of-mail wearer.

original: nisākaro, dhanuṃ gaṇhīti dhanuggaho. Evaṃ kavacaggaho. Dada=dāne, sabbakāmaṃ dadātīti🔽sabbakāmadado, sabbadado. Āto “parokkhāyañcā”ti caggahaṇena dvitte “rasso pubbassā”ti🔽rasse ca annaṃ dadātīti annadado, evaṃ dhanado. Saṃpubbo dhā=dhāraṇe, sabbaṃ sandhahatīti
analyzed: nisākaraḥ dhanum gaṇhi iti dhanuggahaḥ evam kavacaggahaḥ dadadāne sabba kāmam dadāti iti  sabba kāma dadaḥ sabba dadaḥ ā taḥ parokkha āyam ca ati ca ggahaṇena dvitte rassaḥ pubbassa ati  rasse ca annam dadāti iti anna dadaḥ evam dhana daḥ saṃpubbaḥ dha ādhāraṇe sabbam sandhahati iti
translated: He gives, thus he is a giver. He gives all wishes, thus he is a giver of all wishes. He gives all, thus he is a giver of all.🔽The -do is like the -ko in the words “a-ko” and “a-ko” . He gives food, thus he is a food-giver. So too, he is a wealth-giver.🔽He bears, thus he is a bearer. He bears all, thus he is a bearer of all. He leads, thus he is a leader. He leads all, thus he is a leader of all.

original: sabbasandho. Nī=pāpane, vipubbo, vinesi vineti vinessati etena etthāti vā vinayo,🔽e+ayādesā. Nayanaṃ nayo. Si=sevāyaṃ, nipubbo, nissīyatīti nissayo. Si=saye, anusayi
analyzed: sabba sandhaḥ nī pāpane vipubbaḥ vinesi vineti vinessati etena ettha ati vā vinayaḥ  e a y ādesāḥ nayanam nayaḥ siseva ayam nipubbaḥ nissīyati iti nissayaḥ si saye anusayi
translated: He is led, thus he is a led. He is led by all, thus he is a led by all. He is led by some, thus he is a led by some. He is led by one, thus he is a led by one.🔽He is led by none, thus he is a led by none. He is led by the True Idea, thus he is a led by the True Idea. He is led by the True Idea and Discipline, thus he is a led by the True Idea and Discipline.

original: anuseti anusessatīti anusayo. I=gatimhi, patipubbo, paṭicca etasmā phala+metīti paccayo.
analyzed: anuseti anusessati iti anusayaḥ i k atimhi pati pubbaḥ paṭicca etasmā phalam eti iti paccayaḥ
translated: He is led by the True Idea and Discipline, thus he is a led by the True Idea and Discipline. He is led by the True Idea and Discipline, thus he is a led by the True Idea and Discipline. He is led by the True Idea and Discipline, thus he is a led by the True Idea and Discipline. He is led by the True Idea and Discipline, thus he is a led by the True Idea and Discipline. He is led by the True Idea and Discipline, thus he is a led by the True Idea and Discipline. He is led by the True Idea and Discipline, thus he is a led by the

original: Saṃ+upubbo, dāgame samudayo. Ci=caye, vinicchayate+nena vinicchayanaṃ vā vinicchayo,
analyzed: saṃupubbaḥ da āgame samudayaḥ cicaye vinicchaya tenena vinicchayanam vā vinicchayaḥ
translated: Sam+up+ubbo, dāgame samudayo. Ci=caye, vinicchayate+nena vinicchayanaṃ vā vinicchayo,

original: “nito cissa cho”ti cissa cho. Uccayanaṃ uccayo, saṃcayo. Khi=khaye, khayanaṃ khayo.
analyzed: n itaḥ cissa choti cissa cho uccayanam uccayaḥ saṃcayaḥ khi khaye khayanam khayaḥ
translated: “nito cissa cho”ti cissa cho. Uccayanaṃ uccayo, saṃcayo. Khi=khaye, khayanaṃ khayo.

original: Ji=jaye, vijayanaṃ vijayo, jayo. Kī=dabbavinīmaye, vikkayanaṃ vikkayo, kayo. Lī=silesane,
analyzed: jijaye vijayanam vijayaḥ jayaḥ vikkayanam vikkayaḥ kayaḥ līsi lesane
translated: Ji=jaye, vijayanaṃ vijayo, jayo. Kī=dabbavinīmaye, vikkayanaṃ vikkayo, kayo. Lī=silesane,

original: allīyanti etthāti ālayo, layo. (Ivaṇṇantā).
analyzed: allīyanti ettha iti ālayaḥ layaḥ i vaṇṇa ntā
translated: allīyanti etthāti ālayo, layo. (Ivaṇṇantā).

original: Āsuṇantīti assavā, āssa rasso. Paṭissavanaṃ paṭissavo. Su=passavane, ābhavaggā savantīti
analyzed: āsuṇanti iti assavāḥ āssa rassaḥ paṭissavanam paṭissavaḥ supassavane ābha vaggā savanti iti
translated: Āsuṇantīti assavā, āssa rasso. Paṭissavanaṃ paṭissavo. Su=passavane, ābhavaggā savantīti

original: āsavā. Ru=saddo ravatīti ravo. Bhavatīti bhavo. Pabhavati etasmāti pabhavo. Lū=chedane,
analyzed: āsavāḥ rusaddaḥ ravati iti ravaḥ bhavati iti bhavaḥ pabhavati etasmā ati pabhavaḥ lū chedane
translated: āsavā. Ru=saddo ravatīti ravo. Bhavatīti bhavo. Pabhavati etasmāti pabhavo. Lū=chedane,

original: lavanaṃ lavo. (Uvaṇṇantā).
analyzed: lavanam lavaḥ uvaṇṇantā
translated: lavanaṃ lavo. (Uvaṇṇantā).

original: Cara=caraṇe, saṃcaraṇaṃ saṃcaro. Dara=vidāraṇe, ādaranaṃ ādaro. Āgacchati āgamanaṃti
analyzed: cara caraṇe saṃcaraṇam saṃcaraḥ dara vidāraṇe ādaranam ādaraḥ āgacchati
translated: Cara=caraṇe, saṃcaraṇaṃ saṃcaro. Dara=vidāraṇe, ādaranaṃ ādaro. Āgacchati āgamanaṃti

original: vā āgamo. Sappa=gamane, sappatīti sappo. Dibbatīti devo. Pakkamanaṃ pakkamatīti vā
analyzed: vā āgamaḥ sappa gamane sappati iti sappaḥ dibbati iti devaḥ pakkamanam pakkamati iti vā
translated: vā āgamo. Sappa=gamane, sappatīti sappo. Dibbatīti devo. Pakkamanaṃ pakkamatīti vā

original: pakkamo, evaṃ vikkamo. Cara=caraṇe, vanaṃ caratīti vanacaro. Kāmo avacarati etthāti
analyzed: pakkamaḥ evam vikkamaḥ cara caraṇe vanam carati iti vana caraḥ kāmaḥ avacarati ettha ati
translated: and pakkamo, evaṃ vikkamo. Cara=caraṇe, vanaṃ caratīti vanacaro. Kāmo avacarati etthāti

original: kāmāvacaro loko, kāmāvacarā paññā, kāmāvacaraṃ cittaṃ. Gāvo caranti etthāti gocaro.
analyzed: kāma avacaraḥ loko kāma avacarā paññā kāma avacaram cittam gāvaḥ caranti ettha ati gocaro
translated: kāmāvacaro loko, kāmāvacarā paññā, kāmāvacaraṃ cittaṃ. Gāvo caranti etthāti gocaro.

original: Pādena pivatīti pādapo. Evaṃ kacchapo. Sirasmiṃ ruhatīti siroruho, manādittā o. Guhāyaṃ
analyzed: pādena pivati iti pādapaḥ evam kacchapaḥ sirasmim ruhati iti siroruhaḥ guhā ayam
translated: Pādena pivatīti pādapo. Evaṃ kacchapo. Sirasmiṃ ruhatīti siroruho, manādittā o. Guhāyaṃ

original: sayatīti guhāsayaṃ cittaṃ, evaṃ kucchisayā vātā. Pabbate tiṭṭhatīti pabbataṭṭho puriso,
analyzed: sayati iti guhā sayam cittam evam kucchi sayā vātā pabbate tiṭṭhati iti pabbata ṭṭho puriso
translated: sayatīti guhāsayaṃ cittaṃ, evaṃ kucchisayā vātā. Pabbate tiṭṭhatīti pabbataṭṭho puriso,

original: pabbataṭṭhā nadī, pabbataṭṭhaṃ bhasmaṃ. Evaṃ thalaṭṭhaṃ jalaṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: pabbata ṭṭhā nadī pabbata ṭṭham bhasmam evam thala ṭṭham jala ṭṭham
translated: pabbataṭṭhā nadī, pabbataṭṭhaṃ bhasmaṃ. Evaṃ thalaṭṭhaṃ jalaṭṭhaṃ.

original: Kicchatthe dumhi akicchatthe su+īsaṃ+sukha upapadesu-dukkhena karīyati karaṇaṃ vā
analyzed: kicchatthe dumhi a kicchatthe upapade su dukkhena karīyati karaṇam vā
translated: Kicchatthe dumhi akicchatthe su+īsaṃ+sukha upapadesu-dukkhena karīyati karaṇaṃ vā

original: dukkaraṃ. Evaṃ dussayo, dukkhena bharīyatīti dubbharo mahiccho. Evaṃ durakkhaṃ cittaṃ,
analyzed: dukkaram evam dussayaḥ dukkhena bharīyati iti dubbharaḥ mahicchaḥ evam durakkham cittam
translated: dukkaraṃ. Evaṃ dussayo, dukkhena bharīyatīti dubbharo mahiccho. Evaṃ durakkhaṃ cittaṃ,

original: duddaso dhammo, duranubodho dhammo. Īsaṃ sayatīti īsaṃsayo, evaṃ sukhasayo. Īsaṃ
analyzed: duddasaḥ dhammaḥ duranubodhaḥ dhammaḥ īsam sayati iti īsaṃsayaḥ evam sukha sayaḥ īsam
translated: duddaso dhammo, duranubodho dhammo. Īsaṃ sayatīti īsaṃsayo, evaṃ sukhasayo. Īsaṃ

original: karīyatīti īsakkaraṃ kammaṃ. Sukhena karīyatīti sukaraṃ pāpaṃ bālena. Evaṃ subharo
analyzed: karīyati iti īsakkaram kammam sukhena karīyati iti sukaram pāpam bālena evam subharaḥ
translated: ‘It is done with difficulty’ is a difficult action. ‘It is done easily’ is an easy evil for a fool. Thus it is easy to bear.

original: appiccho, sudassaṃ paravajjaṃ, subodha+miccādi. Sabbattha pādiamādisamāsā.🔽Ghaṇa-bhavatīti bhāvo, o+āvādesā. Aya=iti daṇḍakadhātu, ayati itoti āyo, āharatīti
analyzed: appicchaḥ sudassam paravajjam subodham iccādi sabbattha pādiama ādi samāsā  daṇḍaka dhātu āharati iti
translated: ‘He is little-wishing’, ‘it is easy to see another’s fault’, ‘it is easy to understand’, and so on. In all these cases the first word is a noun.🔽‘It comes to be’ is a state. The ‘o’ is a substitute. ‘It goes’ is a way. ‘It is brought’ is a bringing.🔽‘It is destroyed’ is a destruction. ‘It is loved’ is a love.🔽‘It is gone’ is a going. ‘It is gone by’ is a way. ‘It is gone to’ is a bringing. ‘It is gone from’ is a taking away.

original: āhāro. Upahanatīti upaghāto, “hanassa ghāto ṇānubandhe”ti ghātādeso. Rañjatīti rāgo,
analyzed: āhāraḥ upahanati iti upaghātaḥ hanassa ghātaḥ ghāta ghāta ādesaḥ rañjati iti rāgaḥ
translated: ‘It is gone in’ is a penetration. ‘It is gone out’ is a going out. ‘It is gone up’ is a rising. ‘It is gone down’ is a falling.🔽‘It is gone about’ is a wandering. ‘It is gone around’ is a going round. ‘It is gone away’ is a departing. ‘It is gone off’ is a going off.

original: “kagā cajānaṃ ghānubandhe”ti jassa go. Rañjanti anenāti rāgo. “Assā ṇānubandhe”ti🔽ā, pajjate+nenāti pādo. Tuda=byathane, patujjate+nenāti patodo. Jarīyati anenāti🔽jāro, evaṃ dāro. Bhajīyatīti bhāgo. Evaṃ bhāro. Labbhatīti lābho. Vi+opubbo, voharīyatīti
analyzed: kagā gha anubandha iti jassa go rañjanti anena ati rāgaḥ  ā pajja tenena ati pādaḥ tuda byathane patujja tenena ati patodaḥ jarīyati anena ati  jāraḥ evam dāraḥ bhajīyati iti bhāgaḥ evam bhāraḥ labbhati iti lābhaḥ viopubbaḥ voharīyati iti
translated: ‘It is gone together’ is a union. ‘It is gone together with’ is a company. ‘It is gone to’ is a bringing. ‘It is gone from’ is a taking away.🔽‘It is gone in’ is a penetration. ‘It is gone out’ is a going out. ‘It is gone up’ is a rising. ‘It is gone down’ is a falling.🔽‘It is gone about’ is a wandering. ‘It is gone around’ is a going round. ‘It is gone away’ is a departing. ‘It is gone off’ is a going off.

original: vohāro. Diyyatīti dāyo, yuka. Vihaññati etasmāti vighāto. Viharanti etthāti vihāro.
analyzed: vohāraḥ diyyati iti dāyaḥ vihaññati etasmā ati vighātaḥ viharanti ettha ati vihāro
translated: ‘It is gone together’ is a union. ‘It is gone together with’ is a company. ‘It is gone to’ is a bringing. ‘It is gone from’ is a taking away.

original: Āramanti etasminti ārāmo. Pacanaṃ vā pāko, cassa ko. Cajanaṃ cāgo. Yajanaṃ yāgo. Rajanaṃ rāgo.
analyzed: āramanti etasmin ti ārāmaḥ pacanam vā cajanam cāgaḥ yajanam yāgaḥ rajanam rāgaḥ
translated: An ārama is that in which they delight. Or else, cooking is pāka, and its ko is ko. Giving is cajana, and its cā is cā. Sacrifice is yajana, and its yā is yā. Passion is rajana, and its ra is ra.

original: 127. Ana+ghaṇasvā+parīhi ḷo🔽Ā+parīhi parassa dahassa ḷo hota+na+ghaṇasu. Paridahanaṃ pariḷāho. Evaṃ dāho. Bhañjanaṃ
analyzed: ana gha ṇa sva a parīhi ḷaḥ  ā parīhi parassa dahassa ḷaḥ hotana ghaṇasu paridahanam pariḷāhaḥ evam dāhaḥ bhañjanam
translated: Ana+ghaṇasvā+parīhi ḷo

original: saṅgo. Evaṃ saṅgo. Saṃkharanaṃ saṃkhāro, “karotissa kho”ti kassa kho. Evaṃ parikkhāro.
analyzed: saṅgaḥ evam saṅgaḥ saṃkharanam saṃkhāraḥ karotissa kho ti kassa kho evam parikkhāro
translated: The ḷo is added to parīhi of another, if it is not a ghaṇasū. The parīḷāha is the burning up. So too, dāho. The saṅgo is the breaking up. So too, saṅgo. The saṅkhāro is the collecting together. So too, parikkhāro.

original: “Purasmā”ti karassa kho, purekkhāro, ettaṃ tadaminādipāṭhā. Evaṃ upakāro, gāho.
analyzed: karassa kho purekkhāraḥ evam upakāraḥ gāho
translated: The purekkhāro is the one who is in front of the karassa. This is the reading in the Tadaminādi. So too, upakāro, gāho.

original: Gha-vacatīti vako. Sica=paggharaṇe, secanaṃ seko. Evaṃ soko, eovuddhiyo. Yuñjanaṃ yogo.🔽Ka-pī=tappane, pīnetīti pīyo, kānubandhattā na vuddhi, “yuvaṇṇāna+miyaṅuvaṅa sare”ti
analyzed: sica paggharaṇe secanam sekaḥ evam sokaḥ yuñjanam yogo  kapī tappane na sara iti
translated: The vako is the one with the vaka-group. The seko is the sprinkling. So too, soko. The yogo is the yoking.

original: iyaṅa. Khipa=peraṇe, khipatīti khipo. Bhuñjantya+nenāti bhujo. Yudha=sampahāre āyujjhanti anenāti āyudhaṃ.🔽45. Dādhātvi
analyzed: khipa peraṇe khipati iti khipaḥ bhuñjanti anena ati bhujaḥ yudha sampahāre āyujjhanti anena ati āyudham 🔽dādhātvi
translated: The pīyo is the one who heats. It is not an augment because of the connection with ka. The iyaṅa is this. The khipo is the one who hurls. The bhujo is the one by which they eat. The āyudha is the weapon by which they fight.

original: Dādhāto bahula+mi hoti bhāvakārakesu. Dā=dāne, ādiyatītiādi. Evaṃ upādi. Dhā=dhāraṇe,
analyzed: dā dhātoḥ bahulami bhāva kārakesu dā dāne evam upādi dhā dhāraṇe
translated: The form of DĀ is DĀDHĀ, etc., in the words denoting the act of doing. DĀ=giving, he gives the beginning, therefore ĀDI. Thus UPĀDI. DHĀ=bearing,

original: udakaṃ dadhātīti udadhi, “saññāya+mudo+dakassā”ti udakassa udādeso. Jalaṃ dhiyate🔽asminti jaladhi. Vālāni dhīyanti asminti vāladhi. Sandhīyati sandhātīti vā sandhi.🔽Dhīyatīti dhi. Vidhīyati vidhāti vidhānaṃ vā vidhi. Sammā samaṃ vā cittaṃ ādadhātīti samādhi.🔽46. Vamādīhya+thu🔽Vamādīhi bhāvakārakesva+thu hoti. Vama=uggiraṇe, vamanaṃ vamīyatīti vā vamathu. original: abhibhū, sayambhū. Tathā dhu=kampane, sandhunātīti sandhu. Vibhātīti vibhā. Pabhātīti
analyzed: abhibhū sayambhū tathā dhu kampane sandhunāti iti sandhu vibhāti iti vibhā pabhāti iti
translated: Abhibhū, sayambhū. Thus dhu = shaking, sandhunāti = it shakes, vibhātīti = it shines, pabhātīti = it shines forth,

original: pabhā. Saṃgamma bhāsanti etthāti sabhā, “kvimhi lopo+ntabyañjanassā”ti antabyañjanassa
analyzed: pabhā saṃgamma bhāsanti ettha ati sabhā kvimhi lopaḥ u nta byañjanassa ati anta byañjanassa
translated: sabhā = assembly, “kvimhi lopo+ntabyañjanassā” = the final consonant is elided,

original: lopo. Bhujena gacchatīti bhujago. Evaṃ urago. Turaṃ=sīghaṃ gacchatīti turaṅgo. Khena
analyzed: lopaḥ bhujena gacchati iti bhujagaḥ evam uragaḥ turaṃsīgham gacchati iti turaṅgaḥ khena
translated: bhujena gacchatīti = it goes with a limb, thus bhujaṅga. So uraga. Turaṃ = quickly, gacchatīti = it goes, thus turaṅga. Khena

original: gacchatīti khago. Vihāyase gacchatīti vihago, tadaminādipāṭhā vihādeso. Na gacchatīti
analyzed: gacchati iti khagaḥ vihāyase gacchati iti na gacchati iti
translated: gacchatīti = it goes with a wind, thus khaga. Vihāyase gacchatīti = it goes through the sky, thus vihaṅga, this is a change of vihā, “na gacchatīti”

original: nago. Evaṃ ago, “nago vā+ppāṇinī”ti vikappena nañasamāse ṭādesanisedho. Jana=janane,
analyzed: nagaḥ evam agaḥ nagaḥ vāppāṇinī iti vikappena naña samāse ṭa ādesa nisedhaḥ jana janane
translated: nago. So ago. “nago vā+ppāṇinī” = in the compound with na, the prohibition of the change of ṭ to ḍ is optional. Jana = generation,

original: kammato jātoti kammajo, amādisamāso, kammajo vipāko, kammajā paṭisandhi, kammajaṃ
analyzed: kammataḥ jātaḥ iti kamma jaḥ ama ādi samāso kamma jaḥ vipāko kamma jā paṭisandhi kamma jam
translated: kammato jāto = it is born from kamma, this is an amā compound, kammaja vipāka, kammaja paṭisandhi, kammaja

original: rūpaṃ. Evaṃ cittajaṃ, utujaṃ, āhārajaṃ. Attajo putto, vārimhi jāto vārijo. Evaṃ thalajo.
analyzed: rūpam evam citta jam utu jam āhāra jam atta jaḥ puttaḥ vārimhi jātaḥ vāri jaḥ evam thala jo
translated: rūpaṃ. So cittaja, utuja, āhāraja. Attajo putto, vārimhi jāto vārijo. So thalajo.

original: Paṅkajaṃ. Jalajaṃ. Aṇḍajaṃ. Sarasijaṃ, upapadasamāse bahulaṃvidhānā vibhatyalope
analyzed: paṅkajam jala jam aṇḍa jam sarasijam upapada samāse bahulam vidhānā
translated: Paṅkajaṃ. Jalajaṃ. Aṇḍajaṃ. Sarasijaṃ, in the upapada compound, the case ending is often elided.

original: “manādīhī”tiādinā siādeso. Dvikkhattuṃ jāto dvijo, “tadaminā” dinā kkhattuṃlopo.
analyzed: mana ādīhi iti ādinā si ādesaḥ dvi kkhattum jātaḥ dvijaḥ tad aminā dinā kkhattuṃlopaḥ
translated: “Manādīhī” is the place of sibilants. Born twice is dvijo. “Tadaminā” is the elision of khattuṃ.

original: Pacchā jāto anujo. Sañjānātīti saññā. Pajānātīti paññā. Evaṃ patiṭṭhātīti patiṭṭhā.
analyzed: pacchā jātaḥ anujaḥ sañjānāti iti saññā pajānāti iti paññā evam patiṭṭhāti iti patiṭṭhā
translated: Born later is anujo. Sañjānāti is saññā. Pajānāti is paññā. Evaṃ patiṭṭhātīti is patiṭṭhā.

original: Jhā=cintāyaṃ, parasampattiṃ abhijjhāyatīti abhijjhā. Hitesitaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā jhāyatīti
analyzed: jhā cintā ayam para sampattim abhijjhāyati iti abhijjhā hita isitam upaṭṭhāpetvā jhāyati iti
translated: Jhā=cintāyaṃ, parasampattiṃ abhijjhāyatīti is abhijjhā. Hitesitaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā jhāyatīti

original: upajjhā. So eva upajjhāyo, “sakatthe”ti yo. Sammā jhāyanti etthāti saṃjhā. Kvidantā
analyzed: upajjhā saḥ eva upajjhāyaḥ sakatthā iti yaḥ sammā jhāyanti ettha ati saṃjhā
translated: upajjhā. So eva upajjhāyo, “sakatthe” is yo. Sammā jhāyanti etthāti is saṃjhā. Kvidantā

original: dhātvatthaṃ na jahanti, liṅgatthaṃ paṭipādayanti.
analyzed: dhātvattham na jahanti liṅga ttham paṭipādayanti
translated: do not abandon the meaning of the root, they convey the meaning of the gender.

original: 48. Ano
analyzed: ano
translated: Ano

original: Kriyatthā bhāvakārakesu ano hoti. Nanda=samiddhiyaṃ, bhāve-nandiyate nandanaṃ. Kamme-anandīyittha
analyzed: kriyatthāḥ bhāva kārakesu anaḥ hoti nanda samiddhiyam bhāvenandiyate nandanam kammenandīyittha
translated: Ano is for the meaning of action in bhāva and kāraka. Nanda=samiddhiyaṃ, bhāve-nandiyate nandanaṃ. Kamme-anandīyittha

original: nandīyati nandīyissati nanditabbanti vā nandanaṃ vanaṃ. Gahanaṃ gahanīyaṃ vā gahaṇaṃ,
analyzed: nandīyati nandīyissati nanditabbanti vā nandanam vanam gahanam gahanīyam vā gahaṇam
translated: nandīyati nandīyissati nanditabbanti vā nandanaṃ vanaṃ. Gahanaṃ gahanīyaṃ vā gahaṇaṃ,

original: “tathanarā” dinā nassa ṇo. Gaṇhanaṃ, niggahītassa no. Caritabbaṃ caraṇaṃ. Bhuyate
analyzed: tatha narāḥ dinā nassa no gaṇhanam niggahītassa no caritabbam caraṇam bhuyate
translated: “tathanarā” is the elision of nassa ṇo. Gaṇhanaṃ, niggahītassa no. Caritabbaṃ caraṇaṃ. Bhuyate

original: bhavanaṃ. Huyate havanaṃ. Rundhitabbaṃ rundhanaṃ rodhanaṃ vā. Bhuñjitabbaṃ bhuñjanaṃ🔽bhojanaṃ vā. Bujjhitabbaṃ bujjhanaṃ, “padādīnaṃ kvacī”ti yuka. Bodhanaṃ vā. Suti
analyzed: bhavanam huyate havanam rundhitabbam rundhanam rodhanam vā bhuñjitabbam bhuñjanam  bhojanam vā bujjhitabbam bujjhanam pada ādīnam kvaci iti yuka bodhanam vā suti
translated: “To be burnt” is burning. “To be rubbed” is rubbing or stopping. “To be eaten” is eating or food. “To be awakened” is awakening or “in some instances for pad and so on” is allowable. “To be enlightened” is enlightening. “To be heard” is hearing.

original: suyyati vā savanaṃ. Pāpīyatīti pāpuṇanaṃ, “sakāpānaṃ kuka+kū”ti yogavibhāgā kuāgame🔽nāgame ca tassa ṇo ca. Pālīyatīti pālanaṃ iccādi.🔽Kattari-rajaṃ haratīti rajoharaṇaṃ toyaṃ. Vijānātīti viññāṇaṃ. Ghā=gandhopādāne,
analyzed: vā savanam pāpīyati iti pāpuṇanam yogavibhāgā ku āgame  na āgame ca tassa ṇo ca pālīyati iti pālanam iccādi  kattari rajam harati iti rajaḥ haraṇam toyam vijānāti iti viññāṇam gha a gandha upādāne
translated: (The root) hu means to offer. (The root) rundh means to be filled, or to be closed. (The root) bhuñj means to eat. (The root) budh means to be awakened. (The root) śru means to hear. (The root) pāp means to be sinful. (The root) pāla means to protect.

original: ghāyatīti ghānaṃ. Jhā=cintāyaṃ, jhāyatīti jhānaṃ. Karoti anenāti kāraṇaṃ, dīgho.
analyzed: ghāyati iti ghānam jhā cintā ayam jhāyati iti jhānam karoti anena ati kāraṇam
translated: (The root) kṛ means to do. (The root) rañj means to take away dust. (The root) vijñā means to know. (The root) ghā means to smell.

original: Viākarīyanti etenāti byākaraṇaṃ. Pūrati+nenāti pūraṇaṃ. Dīyate+nenāti dānaṃ. Pamīyate+nenāti
analyzed: etena ati byākaraṇam pūratinena ati pūraṇam dīyatenena ati dānam
translated: (The root) jhā means to meditate. (The root) karoti means to do. (The root) vi means to explain. (The root) pūr means to fill. (The root) dā means to give. (The root) pamā means to measure.

original: pamāṇaṃ. Vuccate+nenāti vacanaṃ. Panudati panujjate+nenāti vā panudanaṃ. Sūda=pagaraṇe,
analyzed: pamāṇam vuccatenena ati vacanam panudati panujjatenena ati vā panudanam sūda apagaraṇe
translated: (The root) vac means to speak. (The root) panud means to remove. (The root) sūda means to cook.

original: sūdati sujjate+nenāti vā sūdano. Suṇāti suyate+neneti vā savanaṃ. Luyati luyate+neneti🔽vā lavanaṃ. Evaṃ nayanaṃ. Punāti puyate+neneti vā pavano. Sametīti samaṇo samanaṃ🔽vā. Tathā bhāveti bhāvīyati etāyāti vā bhāvanaṃ. Evaṃ pācanaṃ pācāpanaṃ iccādi. “Ana+saṇasvā
analyzed: sūdati sujjatenena ati vā sūdanaḥ suṇāti suyatenena iti vā savanam luyati luyatenena iti  vā lavanam evam nayanam punāti vā sameti iti samaṇaḥ samanam  vā tathā vā bhāvanam vā bhāvanam evam pācanam iccādi
translated: Or it is a cleanser because of cleansing, or because of being cleansed by it. Or it is hearing because of hearing, or because of being made to hear by it. Or it is a wetting because of wetting, or because of being wetted by it.🔽So it is seeing. Or it is a purifying because of purifying, or because of being purified by it. Or it is an ascetic because of being associated with sameness, or because of being an ascetic.

original: parīhi ḷo”ti ḷo, āḷāhanaṃ.
analyzed: parīhi ḷo ti ḷo āḷāhanam
translated: So it is a development because of developing, or because of being developed by it. So it is a cooking, a cooking-place, and so on. “Ana+saṇasvā parīhi ḷo” , the ḷo is a pressing.

original: Adhikaraṇe-tiṭṭhati asinti ṭhānaṃ. Evaṃ sayanaṃ, senaṃ vā āsanaṃ. Adhikarīyati etthāti adhikaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: adhikaraṇe tiṭṭhati asinti ṭhānam evam sayanam senam vā āsanam adhikarīyati ettha ati adhikaraṇam
translated: “Adhikaraṇe-tiṭṭhati asinti ṭhānaṃ” . So it is a lying-down, or a bed, or a seat. It is a legal question because of being adjudicated here.

original: Sampadānāpādānesu-sammā padīyate yassa taṃ sampadānaṃ. Apecca etasmā ādadātīti apādānaṃ.
analyzed: sampadāna apādānesu sammā padīyate yassa tam sampadānam apecca etasmai ādadāti iti apādānam
translated: “Sampadānāpādānesu-sammā padīyate yassa taṃ sampadānaṃ. Apecca etasmā ādadātīti apādānaṃ” .

original: Bahulādhikārā calanādīhipi sīlasādhudhammesupi ano, calati sīlenāti calano evaṃ jalano,
analyzed: bahula adhikārā sīla sādhu dhammesu pi calati sīlena ati evam
translated: “Bahulādhikārā calanādīhipi sīlasādhudhammesupi ano, calati sīlenāti calano” . So it is a burning,

original: kodhano, kopano. Maṇḍa=bhusane, maṇḍeti sīlenāti maṇḍano. Evaṃ bhūsano. “Aññātrapī”ti okāranisedho.
analyzed: kodhanaḥ kopanaḥ maṇḍa bhusane maṇḍeti sīlena ati maṇḍanaḥ evam bhūsanaḥ okāra nisedho
translated: an angry man, an angry person. Maṇḍa=bhusane, maṇḍeti sīlenāti maṇḍano. So it is an ornament. “Aññātrapī” means a prohibition of the context.

original: 49. Itthiya+ma+ṇa+kti+ka+yaka+yā ca🔽Itthiliṅge bhāve kārake ca kriyatthā aādayo honti ano ca bahulaṃ.🔽A-jara=vayohāniyaṃ, jirati jiraṇaṃ vā jarā. “Itthiya+ma+tvā”ti āpaccayo. Paṭisambhijjatīti🔽paṭisambhidā. Paṭipajjati etāyāti paṭipadā. Evaṃ sampadā, āpadā. Upādīyatīti upādā.🔽Ikkha+cakkha=dassane, upaikkhatīti upekkhā. “Yuvaṇṇāna+meo luttā”ti ekāro. Cintanaṃ🔽cintā. Sikkha=vijjopādāne, sikkhanaṃ sikkhīyantīti vā sikkhā. Evaṃ bhikkhā. Icchanaṃ🔽icchā. “Gamayami”ccādinā cchaṅādeso. Puccha=pucchane, pucchanaṃ pucchā. Midha+medha=saṅgame,🔽apaṭhitadhātu, medhanaṃ medhā. Evaṃ gudha=pariveṭhane, godhanaṃ godhā. Titikkhanaṃ
analyzed: itthiya maṇakti kaya kayā ca  itthi liṅge bhāve kārake ca kriyatthāḥ a ādayaḥ honti ano ca bahulam  ajara vayaḥ hāniyam jirati jiraṇam vā jarā itthiya matvā ati ā paccayo paṭisambhijjati iti  paṭisambhidā paṭipajjati etāya ati paṭipadā evam sampadā āpadā upādīyati iti upādā  ikkha cakkha dassane upaikkhati iti upekkhā luttā ati ekāraḥ cintanam  cintā sikkha vijjā upādāne sikkhanam sikkhīyanti iti vā sikkhā evam bhikkhā icchanam  icchā gamayam icca ādinā puccha pucchane pucchanam pucchā midha medha saṅgame  a paṭhita dhātu medhanam medhā evam gudha pariveṭhane godhanam godhā titikkhanam
translated: 49. Feminine, masculine, neuter, and the like, and the like

original: titikkhā. Evaṃ vīmaṃsā, jigucchā, pipāsā, puttiyā. Īhanaṃ īhā.
analyzed: titikkhā evam vīmaṃsā jigucchā pipāsā puttiyā īhanam īhā
